672522432.name: Best place in all central America
672522432.author: a TripAdvisor user
672522432.reviewBody: The waterfall is something else pure water and very quiet place. I will never forget this place.....

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

646004218.name: Pools of Clear Inviting water
646004218.author: a TripAdvisor user
646004218.reviewBody: Great place to retreat and relax. From Kayaking to row boating in this hidden paradise. Restaurant on site and plenty of Cervezas.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

605818862.name: Lagartero is good. This place is infuriating.
605818862.author: a TripAdvisor user
605818862.reviewBody: I picked up about. 2kg of beer bottle caps in about 2 square meters in one of the multiple streams. A guard from inah told us that the bins are in such bad shape because if they were new people steal them... Skip the lakes, go to lagartero.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

500345048.name: Our favourite place south of Comitan
500345048.author: a TripAdvisor user
500345048.reviewBody: Lagos de Colon is less known than Lagos de Montebello but it is more beautiful and more tropical.  It is our favourite to take visitors.  The water is so clear.  You can swim, jump, have fish foot massage, etc.  The neat thing about Lagos de Colon is there is a small pyramid and ruins within the area.  After climbing the pyramid, you can swim in one of the lagoons.  There is also a mini waterfall where you can observe a lot of Guatemalans crossing for the day, sometimes just to swim there.  It is highly recommended if you are crossing to or from the Guatemalan border (Ciudad Cuauhtemoc /La Mesilla).  It is only about 30 minutes from the border.  There are also nice cabins for you to stay the night there.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

362398339.name: GREAT OASIS NEAR GUATEMALA BUT MORE SAFE CAUSE IS MEXICO
362398339.author: a TripAdvisor user
362398339.reviewBody: If you like to conquer great lanscapes full with cristal clear lagoons here\u00b4s the place, this place is a natural water park that has 44 lagoons, 3 natural rivers, 14 cascades, it is of great value the entrance fee is about 2 dollars there are nice cozy log cabins inside the park that run from 30 dollars a night for a sibgle bed and $40 for a double bed. this place is about 3 hours drive from Tuxtla the state capital of Chiapas M\u00e9xico.\nInside this "ejido" that the name of the land that belong to many locals is a archeological Mayan site worth exploring it, there many wyas to get there, for instance we arrive to the Tuxta International from Houston, Tx. We rent a 4x4 SUV and went there with GPS, in the way we visitied San Cristobal de las Casas a colonial city with many handcrafts and prehispanic cultures that still remain alive, then we drove southeast to Comitan city we stayed therefor the night there are many cheap not crappy hotels, after we ate breakfast we headed to this paradise, it is really great if you like a litle adventure, there were many highways and two way roads but it is really save, mostly in broad day light.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

324517274.name: My favorite weekend spot!!
324517274.author: a TripAdvisor user
324517274.reviewBody: My husband and I are Americans living in Guatemala, and must renew our passport visas every 90 days.  We have been going to Mexico, and after a friendly family recommended it, making regular trips to Lagos de Colon, outside of La Mesilla, GT.  This is an astonishingly beautiful, peaceful and relaxing place to spend a few days.  It is filled with rivers, springs, cascades of fresh water and is about a mile from a very accessible archaeological site as well.  For less than $2.50 per person admission is very reasonable, there are hiking trails, swimming holes, boats for rent, picnic areas, cabins, and good food from local restaurants.  It is clean, safe and an ecological reserve.  Every time we have gone, we have been happy.  And I can\'t wait to go back.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Internacional 190

605818408.name: Fell in love.
605818408.author: a TripAdvisor user
605818408.reviewBody: If you go there after reading this review, can you tell me how many steps there are to get to the acropolis. The place is beautiful just on the way and within view from the acropolis you can see the enviromental impact of human activity in the surrounding areas in a sad way,

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

598296009.name: Quick getaway
598296009.author: a TripAdvisor user
598296009.reviewBody: We have 2 kids but decided to go as a couple only. Our kids would have loved it. Its free! We decided to accept a tour guide, Uriel, and he was very knowledgeable. He has been there for a long time and we really appreciated his help. There are not too many ruins but its a nice, quick, place to tour.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

520903370.name: We fled
520903370.author: a TripAdvisor user
520903370.reviewBody: First we were accosted by a disheveled guy with no teeth who told us a bunch of useless information and wanted a tip. Two kids asked the inevitable "where are you from" and wanted to be guides. Next we found that the site was almost underwater, and you cannot bring anything except a camera and water. Leave everything else in your car at the mercy of the passersby. Maybe we missed a gorgeous site, but we left. Sometimes arbitrary rules and endless begging and angling for tips gets to be too much.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

473009815.name: Beautiful location
473009815.author: a TripAdvisor user
473009815.reviewBody: Interesting Maya site with lagoons and ball courts. No museum but the museums in Comitan and Tuxtla Guitierrez have sculptures and ceramics from there. It is helpful to have a guide; there are no information signs. We hired the 13 yo boy (off school that day) who obviously had had classes in the archeology of the site. Beautiful views from the top of the tallest structure.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

372751806.name: Chinkultic is like no other Maya site
372751806.author: a TripAdvisor user
372751806.reviewBody: The location is sublime, it\'s a small site but I didn\'t see anything similar while I\'ve seen many Maya ruins during the last 20 years. This is one of my favourites.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

343790490.name: Don\'t miss this nice little site!
343790490.author: a TripAdvisor user
343790490.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this nice little site if you are close, no entrance fee and interesting, close to a cenote and good views

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

325460557.name: Thanks, Mexico, for your stewardship of these sites.
325460557.author: a TripAdvisor user
325460557.reviewBody: The government of Mexico has made a special effort to preserve the many archaeological sites that dot this beautiful country.  Chinkultic is a great place to see pyramids, sports fields, and a village that served this part of the Mayan world.  The site is extensive and very clean and well-kept.  There are guides/guards who are unobtrusive but well informed and aware of everything.  There are stellae (stone statues) with good explanations in parts of the park and several sites that are yet to be excavated.  This is history in a stunning site filled with trees, flowers, ruins and good people who are proud of their heritage.  I highly recommend it.\n\nJust outside the gates was a comedor with typical Chiapas food.  I suggest you try it.  I had a quesadilla filled with squash blossoms and queso fundido.  May have been the best food I have ever eaten.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

307559633.name: Amazing
307559633.author: a TripAdvisor user
307559633.reviewBody: Its a Maya Ruins next to Comitan Chiapas , have and increible views from the top, you can admire a lake used like ceremonial place , the Lagunas the Montebello system start here but the must is his "juego d pelota" , ball game stadium used by mayas every 52 years period to honor his gods , also, I recommend to hie a local guide to show the place and explain the stories around here.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

277107684.name: The colors of a Mayan paradise
277107684.author: a TripAdvisor user
277107684.reviewBody: While small by the standards of other Mayan archeological zones in the area like Tenam Puente, Chinkultic is a perfect gem of a site, with its perfect little ball courts, pyramids and cenote, set on a hill with a particularly fine view.  From the top, your eyes will take in a string of blue lakes, lime-green fields bordered by deeper green jungle, grey cliffs, blue sky and maybe a flock of shining white herons flying from color to color. The only drawbacks to this site are the steepness of the steps going up to the pyramids and the occasional flooding of the bridge that leads to the steps, occasionally making the place inaccessible at the end of the rainy season (October-November). It is easy to include a visit to Chinkultic on a trip to the Lakes of Montebello (Parque Nacional Lagunas de Montebello).  The site closes around 4:30 so be sure to allow a couple of hours to see it.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

260741238.name: Lush and relaxing
260741238.author: a TripAdvisor user
260741238.reviewBody: Compared to other archaeological cities I\'ve visited in central Mexico and Oaxaca where you dash across sun-baked dry expanses, Chinkultic was lush and forested... felt like a walk in the countryside, with pyramids. Trees, birdsong, lawns, a relaxing pace. As with all ancient cities we\'d benefit from reading up first, as I\'m not 100% confident in the guards/guides\' accuracy. There\'s a climb up a hill with a view of a sacrificial cenote, and detailed bas-reliefs next to the ball court, and it seems that the forested hills are actually more pyramids that just haven\'t been excavated. There\'s no entrance fee and I\'d definitely recommend it.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

189174508.name: Surprise and great views
189174508.author: a TripAdvisor user
189174508.reviewBody: The ruins were an oasis with great views, a cenote and preserved reliefs.  The grounds were well maintained.

address.streetAddress: A 55 km de Comitan

473013483.name: Traditional town
473013483.author: a TripAdvisor user
473013483.reviewBody: Comitan remains a traditional small city; few foreign tourists. The plaza is a hive of activity with dancing on Thursday and Sunday evenings. All ages come to both watch and dance to live music. \nThere are several art museums, a historic house belonging to one of the heros of the Revolution, an archeology museum and is a good center for several archeology sites and the Lagos de Montebello.

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

456734761.name: BE SURE TO VISIT AT CHRISTMASTIME
456734761.author: a TripAdvisor user
456734761.reviewBody: Comitan is a charming city about 1 1/2 hours from San Cristobal, not much frequented by English-speaking tourists.  It\'s really a shame since we spent 3 days there over Christmas and enjoyed every minute. At Christmastime, the main street, the plaza and kiosk are filled with an amazing profusion of lights and Christmas decorations, including a live nativity scene, which at nighttime is quite spectacular. During the day, you can enjoy the beautiful plants and statuary in the plaza, the surrounding historical buildings, have a drink or try some typical dishes at one of the restaurants on the plaza, buy local handicrafts at the main market or in one of the nearby shops or visit the Casa de Cultura, the small museum of archaeology or the Museo Bellisario Dominguez.

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

364951535.name: Art and Culture together
364951535.author: a TripAdvisor user
364951535.reviewBody: Sunday afternoon stroll on the Zocalo is always a great atmosphere . It is very social family,s,vendors and music what else would you like. The trees are very nice shaped and in the evening full with birds. Round the Zocalo are all different sculptures very nice. The little train packed with children happy faces go,s around.

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

311558382.name: Nice place to visit!
311558382.author: a TripAdvisor user
311558382.reviewBody: If you want to see a traditional town, with beautiful and old buildings, this is the place. You can walk trough the main streets and see a lot: handicrafts, museums, parks, etc. Food around this area is very traditional, and the traditional markets are full of color and sounds!

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

301400025.name: Nice small city without many tourists!
301400025.author: a TripAdvisor user
301400025.reviewBody: We stayed here for 1 night and loved it, it\u00b4s a small Pueblo Magico with a nice Zocalo full with locals, you wont see many tourist here. Wander around the small streets, listen to a street Marimba playing, eat at one of the restaurants from the Zocalo and enjoy the contact with locals.

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

244091853.name: Charming but dull
244091853.author: a TripAdvisor user
244091853.reviewBody: I was staying in San Cristobal de las Casas, and did a day trip here. It was charming in a sleepy, provincial way but also, frankly, as dull as dirt!

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

240847986.name: Cute little town
240847986.author: a TripAdvisor user
240847986.reviewBody:
Comitan is a big modern town compared to other "pueblitos" in Chiapas, but the historical district in downtown is totally different.

It's only a couple of blocks, but it's worth to spend the afternoons here, there are nice restaurants bars and coffee shops around the main plaza, you can stroll around and visit the "casa de la cultura", city hall and museums.

On weekends there are bands playing and literally all families come out and relax (mom, dad and the kids) it's really safe and inexpensive to have a relaxing time.

itemReviewed.name: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

address.streetAddress: Pueblo Magico - Kiosko, Zocalo y Calles Del Centro de la Ciudad

453915594.name: Beautiful
453915594.author: a TripAdvisor user
453915594.reviewBody: This is a beautiful park in a beautiful city. Comit\u00e1n is known by the flowers that grow in the city; the park is decorated with some of them. This site is surrounded by Colonial buildings and there are several eateries around the park.\nThis is a great place to spend the evening either with a good book, the couple or the family. Great place to enjoy life.

address.streetAddress: Central Poniente

350364406.name: Beautiful city park on top of a mountain!
350364406.author: a TripAdvisor user
350364406.reviewBody: Of course, the fact that it was all decked out for the Christmas holidays was beautiful, it is a lovely well-maintained park.  Our hotel was only a couple of blocks away so we strolled down there numerous times in both daylight and dark. Saturday night there was a marimba band playing, many chairs for the watchers, and lots of couples out on the "dance floor"! Quite a fun evening! There are cafes, bars, and restaurants all around the square.

address.streetAddress: Central Poniente

643386082.name: very nice place- highly recomended.
643386082.author: a TripAdvisor user
643386082.reviewBody: on the way ot lagunas de montebello we stoped at ZA Tenam Puente.\nwe took Luis as a guide. during the next 1.5 hours luis explained and teached us (family of 6, kids ages 16,13,11,8) about the history of Tenam and the serrounding area.\nhighly recomended.

address.streetAddress: A 10 km de Comitan

605819311.name: Highplace
605819311.author: a TripAdvisor user
605819311.reviewBody: It\'s definitely worth it. You can tell that mayan people were strategically building their centers in high places. And the place is a place to enjoy, we were supposed to spend 1 hour there and ended up there for 3. There\'s a certain "feel" to the place. The only problem is that there are a bunch of mosquitoes specially in places with shade.

address.streetAddress: A 10 km de Comitan

473012280.name: Great find
473012280.author: a TripAdvisor user
473012280.reviewBody: This is a very large Maya site; lots of walking and climbing. Well shaded. You can spend hours here.There was a young man playing the recorder when we visited which added to the atmosphere. Well worth the visit. You can take a taxi out there and arrange for the driver to pick you up in 3-4 hrs..

address.streetAddress: A 10 km de Comitan

353923588.name: HUGE!
353923588.author: a TripAdvisor user
353923588.reviewBody: Very cool place! A lot larger than it seemed at first, very cool place to visit and explore! Great for groups, or just you and a friend!

address.streetAddress: A 10 km de Comitan

310577752.name: Great site - peaceful as it seems other toursits have not discovered it
310577752.author: a TripAdvisor user
310577752.reviewBody: We visited Tenam Puente ruin this summer.  It\'s about 15 miles outside of the City of Comitan, and not as easy to get to as other sites I have visited.  It cost about 200 Pesos to get there by Taxi, and given the route we took to get out, that was the right way to go.  It was about $50 pesos per person to get in, but once in we were treated to a sprawling beautiful site.  Lots to climb on and explore, the signs were great.  Sadly the ticket stand lacks a gift shop - if someone could write a book about the site to sell it would be most helpful and maybe make some money for the site.  We even got to see one of the researchers at work cleaning some bones recovered at the site.  This person gave us lots of information we might not have learned.  It was a great place - take a picnic lunch as there are no diners or shops nearby.  When it was time to go back to town, the gate guard called a Combi for us, and for about 20 pesos a person we were transported back to the center of town.

address.streetAddress: A 10 km de Comitan

653526381.name: pariso escondido
653526381.author: a TripAdvisor user
653526381.reviewBody: Tranquilo e ideal para nadar, si llevas familia con mucha precauci\u00f3n para ni\u00f1os, no cuenta con ba\u00f1o, ni socorristas en el lugar. precauci\u00f3n sobre todo si no sabes nadar, profundidad aproximada 50 mts.

569427086.name: Hermoso lago cerca de Uninajab
569427086.author: a TripAdvisor user
569427086.reviewBody: Un lugar tranquilo para estar en familia, no ofrece servicios para el turista, pero vale la pena un momento de tranquilidad.

483775647.name: PAZ EN MEDIO DE LA NADA
483775647.author: a TripAdvisor user
483775647.reviewBody: Para disfrutar de esta hermosa laguna, deber\u00e1s llevar un kayak a lancha inflable. Con los pies sobre la tierra y desde la orilla disfrutar\u00e1s el entorno y la ver\u00e1s bonita, pero para apreciar lo azul y cristalino deber\u00e1s navegar o nadar.

344306898.name: Un hermoso rinc\u00f3n para nadar
344306898.author: a TripAdvisor user
344306898.reviewBody: Un hermoso rinc\u00f3n al final de un camino que no llega a ning\u00fan lado. Tienes que pasar el peque\u00f1o poblado de Uninajab donde no hay mucho que hacer, ver\u00e1s un peque\u00f1o r\u00edo de agua cristalina que cruza el lugar y una serie de albercas al aire libre con palapas donde puedes organizar d\u00edas de campo con la familia. Sigue tu camino rumbo al lago, te llevaras una grata sorpresa al llegar. Un peque\u00f1o lago de agua azul y verde turquesa tan cristalina que puedes ver el fondo desde la superficie. El agua no es fr\u00eda por lo que es una delicia para nadar o snorkelear. Una ventaja es que puedes llegar en coche hasta la orilla del lago. No hay vestidores ni ning\u00fan tipo de infraestructura as\u00ed que debes ir preparado. Es un lugar ideal para organizar un d\u00eda de campo con la familia. Disfruta de un lindo d\u00eda!

605817835.name: Surprise
605817835.author: a TripAdvisor user
605817835.reviewBody: If you haven\'t visited any arqueological zone near comitan, check out the museum so you can make a decision and have more information about the places you\'ll visit in comitan. Really help me to appreciate tenam puente and chinkultik better.

address.streetAddress: 1a Calle Sur Poniente s/n

473010299.name: Excellent small museum
473010299.author: a TripAdvisor user
473010299.reviewBody: Another well displayed INAH museum in an old building with a pretty courtyard. The signage is minimal however and you cannot take photos even without flash. The guard there that day was very knowledgable and happy to share with us.

address.streetAddress: 1a Calle Sur Poniente s/n

461313944.name: A Small Jewel.  Great way to spend an afternoon!
461313944.author: a TripAdvisor user
461313944.reviewBody:
The information in the museum about development of society at different times was the outstanding, and the exhibits were clearly labeled so you could see progress and  changes over time.   It was the first time I've ever really enjoyed early art and history so much.    Not a huge collection, but it did have actual pieces from nearby ruins we had visited at Chinquiltic, and made that visit more meaningful in retrospect.  There was also a section on Tenam Puente.  Most fun was the temporary exhibit consisting of copies of artifacts which one could touch and hold.  It had braille and auto recordings to give many an opportunity.   Such cute figures!  Wish it were a permanent exhibit.

There was a soda vending machine, so if you're folks like us who read and ponder everything we see in a museum and need a break, you can have a drink and enjoy sitting around the beautiful patio.  There are also clean, well-functioning bathrooms.

Unfortunately, at this time there are no English transcriptions of the excellently-written signs.  I was able to translate for my husband, but the lack of English is a definite loss.  I have offered to provide them a translation if they will send me pictures of the signs, and am waiting to hear from them.

address.streetAddress: 1a Calle Sur Poniente s/n

239098097.name: Cool
239098097.author: a TripAdvisor user
239098097.reviewBody: I\'ve never studied Spanish, but have managed to pick up quite a\nbit of it over the years. Signage here is mainly in Spanish. Some very nice artifacts. Good for about a hour.

address.streetAddress: 1a Calle Sur Poniente s/n

233661936.name: Good exhibits on Mayan culture and history
233661936.author: a TripAdvisor user
233661936.reviewBody: We found two permanent exhibit rooms and one room that housed a traveling exhibit.  The permanent rooms were only documented in Spanish whereas the traveling exhibit was documented in Spanish and English.  There was a wide range of artifacts that were quite interesting.  There were also quite a few photographs and paintings.  We enjoyed spending about an hour there and found it quite worthwhile even though I wasn\'t able to understand much of what was written in Spanish!

address.streetAddress: 1a Calle Sur Poniente s/n

385362087.name: Interesante
385362087.author: a TripAdvisor user
385362087.reviewBody: Zona Arqueol\u00f3gica de interesante visita cercana a Comitan, a\u00fan se conserva muy natural, para los amantes de la cultura. Muy impecable recorrido..!!

address.streetAddress: A 1.5km del Centro Historico de Comitan

363334835.name: Zona arqueologica dentro de Comitan!!
363334835.author: a TripAdvisor user
363334835.reviewBody: Interesante zona arqueologica en las afueras de Comitan, aun virgen en algunas partes, no muy grande pero te deja mucho a la imaginacion!! te sientes un aventurero descubriendo sus piramides entre la maleza!!

address.streetAddress: A 1.5km del Centro Historico de Comitan

311362596.name: Maravillosa vista desde la cima de su piramide
311362596.author: a TripAdvisor user
311362596.reviewBody: Un sitio completamente apartado de los corredores tur\u00edsticos de Chiapas, sin embargo, es muy interesante. Se encuentra ubicado a las afueras de la ciudad de Comit\u00e1n; sobre un cerro alto. Una vez que se esta en la cima, la vista de la ciudad es impresionante.

address.streetAddress: A 1.5km del Centro Historico de Comitan

594119101.name: Colonial little town
594119101.author: a TripAdvisor user
594119101.reviewBody: Beautiful place, great food and colonial structures. You can walk down town and you can experience the little town feeling.

address.streetAddress: Palacio Municipal S/N

640013997.name: precioso lugar
640013997.author: a TripAdvisor user
640013997.reviewBody: Debes de quedarte a dormir en el hotel que est\u00e1 ah\u00ed. pues est\u00e1 lejos de llegar y no est\u00e1 caro quedarse a dormir ah\u00ed. las caba\u00f1as tiene agua caliente y est\u00e1n muy bien puestas. El restaurante esta deliciosos y nada caro.

address.streetAddress: Montes Azules reserve

622774343.name: No est\u00e1n mal.
622774343.author: a TripAdvisor user
622774343.reviewBody: Para llegar debes salir de Comit\u00e1n con rumbo a lagos de Montebello. LLENA EL TANQUE DE TU CARRO ANTES DE INICIAR EL VIAJE, la \u00faltima gasolinera est\u00e1 antes de llegar a los lagos y no hay m\u00e1s despu\u00e9s de ese punto. Al cruzar la caseta de Montebello, comenta que vas a Las Nubes y as\u00ed evitar\u00e1s pagar la entrada al parque, desde ese momento y en adelante no hay recepci\u00f3n de celular. La carretera tiene muchas curvas, muchos caminos de incorporaci\u00f3n  y muchos topes, maneja con precauci\u00f3n. Eventualmente encontrar\u00e1s un letrero que dice Centro Ecotur\u00edstico Las Nubes, da vuelta ah\u00ed. En ese momento saldr\u00e1s de la carretera principal y posteriormente encontrar\u00e1s otro letrero donde igualmente debes dar vuelta, pon atenci\u00f3n!!, no es tan llamativo. A partir del segundo letrero son 10 Km para llegar, alternando entre terraceria y camino medianamente pavimentado/empedrado. Un autom\u00f3vil mediano puede entrar sin problemas, pero si tienes oportunidad de llevar una SUV o pickup disfrutaras muchos m\u00e1s (y sin sufrir). La recomendaci\u00f3n general siempre ser\u00e1 que viajes de d\u00eda y est\u00e9s en tu destino a m\u00e1s tardar a las 1800 hrs. El costo de las caba\u00f1as  en la Nubes en temporada baja es $1,000 por noche (aceptan tarjeta de cr\u00e9dito). El lugar est\u00e1 padr\u00edsimo!!, todo el personal siempre est\u00e1 dispuesto a apoyarte en lo que necesites. El lugar cuenta con varias actividades, nosotros optamos por el rafting (altamente recomendable), tambi\u00e9n recorrimos el sendero que est\u00e1 por un lado de la reserva, muy bueno. La vista de la cascada est\u00e1 incre\u00edble. El concepto general del lugar es descanso y contemplaci\u00f3n de la naturaleza por lo que no hay actividades nocturnas. El restaurante cierra a las 1945 hrs, prevee llevar aperitivos, el poblado m\u00e1s cercano est\u00e1 a 1.0 Km y no est\u00e1 permitido deambular despu\u00e9s de las 2100 hrs. La comida y el caf\u00e9 no son buenos y no es que esperara platillos Gourmet pero para la opciones que te ofrecen si esperaba mayor esmero en su preparaci\u00f3n, adem\u00e1s la calidad no va de la mano con los costos. Si tienes plan de descanso, poco ajetreo y alejarte de la cuidad, est\u00e1 es la opci\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Montes Azules reserve

405235955.name: Small but very special
405235955.author: a TripAdvisor user
405235955.reviewBody: We paid the equivalent of a quarter US and spent about an hour and a half enjoying the art here.  Very intriguing works that put a modern edge on traditional images and scenes.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Hermila Dominguez de Castellanos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Central sur # 51 Centro Histórico de Comitán

299674066.name: gem in the rough
299674066.author: a TripAdvisor user
299674066.reviewBody: This is a most remote part of Mexico in the impoverished state of Chiapas and yet there is an art museum that is stupendous. Enjoyed the work more than the Tamayo Art Museum in DF.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Hermila Dominguez de Castellanos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Central sur # 51 Centro Histórico de Comitán

233662849.name: Good selection of modern art!
233662849.author: a TripAdvisor user
233662849.reviewBody: Although they didn\'t have power when we visited, the natural lighting allowed us to enjoy about 80% of the art in this two story museum.  It is all modern art, a mix of mediums.  We toured it in about an hour and we hope to go back when they do have lights!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Hermila Dominguez de Castellanos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Central sur # 51 Centro Histórico de Comitán

669785657.name: Best Adventure Ever!
669785657.author: a TripAdvisor user
669785657.reviewBody: This review is way overdue.  My family and I traveled to Chiapas, Mexico last year and visited 4 different cities in Chiapas including Comitan.  We visited many beautiful waterfalls and had a handful of amazing experience but none like the 3 Tzimoleras.  Hands down the 3 Tzimoleras was the best experience of our whole entire trip!  Angel and his crew including Sarain, made this adventure unforgettable.  We started the trip to the waterfall in a pickup truck which was an adventure all on its own.  There were 11 in our group including 2 young children.  Once there, we climbed down tons of stairs (with alot of help from Angel and his crew) to get to experience the most beautiful waterfalls you will ever see.  I say experience because you get to stand so close to the front of the waterfall and feel its tremendous power and admire its amazing beauty.  For those with more of an adventurous and brave spirit than me, you can take a 7 meter jump into the most beautiful blue lagoon you have ever seen close to the edge of the waterfall.  If you are brave enough to go through with it (only one in our family was) you are rewarded with a walk to the edge of the waterfall. My cousin did it and said it was the most unbelievable experience and one he will never forget.  In summary, if you ever find yourself in Chiapas, make sure you go to the 3 Tzimoleras.  You will not regret it!

663224821.name: A Little Paradise
663224821.author: a TripAdvisor user
663224821.reviewBody: Without a doubt, the best day of our trip! Not only is the location absolutely magical, but Las 3 Tzimoleras\' team is just fantastic, super sympathetic and welcoming. \nThe beauty of the waterfalls and the strength of the nature out there are just amazing. The tour itself is really well organized. We felt secure at all time while also feeling that the pace of our small group was leading the way through the day. To be honest, our only regret is that we only went there for a day trip. If you have the opportunity to camp there, go for it! \nThank you Angel for sharing your love for this wonderful area, and thanks to everyone from Las 3 Tzimoleras!

643449149.name: Can\'t Miss Experience
643449149.author: a TripAdvisor user
643449149.reviewBody:
Where do I even start ? Before I even get to how great the experience was, I must first say that Angel and Quinn went way beyond the call of duty as they spent over an hour on the phone solving an airline issue for us. That just shows the quality of people they are.

As to the experience itself, it is a can't miss ! You will never experience something like this as you swim through beautiful waterfalls and jump off cliffs into water, all with the utmost safety in mind. They also provide you with free photos of the whole adventure and are excellent guides.

You need to make this trip if you go to Mexico !

635904264.name: A great day!
635904264.author: a TripAdvisor user
635904264.reviewBody: A friend of Chiapas recommended this activity and it was a great day! We stayed in Comitan and took a collective to tzimol to join the tour. The place is beautiful and completely wild! The guides are very friendly and helpful. They offer a light lunch for an extra fee. It was delicious!! Highly recommended!

611799226.name: high point in Mexico
611799226.author: a TripAdvisor user
611799226.reviewBody:
When we think of our trip to Mexico, the first thing that comes  in mind is las 3 tzimoleras.
What a experience!!!!
The day trip is so good organized.
The guides feel really well what tourists want.
Las 3 tzimoleras is really a hidden gem in Chiapas.
The waterfalls are so beautiful, I was really moved by the beauty of nature
Angel, you and your team are doing a great job!!!
You give people a day you never forget in your life
Thanks

609353091.name: Great experience
609353091.author: a TripAdvisor user
609353091.reviewBody: the 3 tzimoleras are virgins waterfalls, awesome view, you can swim and dive in some of them!! Angel and his crew were really kind

570855848.name: AMAZING!!!
570855848.author: a TripAdvisor user
570855848.reviewBody: This was one of the most incredible trips I have done in my life, we have so much fun and the place... the place is more than the words can describe... it\'s a paradise!!! I defetenely will do it again and I highly recomended... the guides are GREAT!!! Erick, Osmar, Angel... all of them, they made our experience unforgetable ;-)

570113420.name: Unforgettable day !!
570113420.author: a TripAdvisor user
570113420.reviewBody: Our guided Day  was a great experience. Our guides were very knowledgeable understanding and friendly.\n The park is truly amazing. Beautifully  concerved and cared for with no glitter... just raw nature.  Very recommended.

566555083.name: A magic trip in family !
566555083.author: a TripAdvisor user
566555083.reviewBody:
Excellent trip in familly with our guide !! We spent 2 days incredibles in the pure nature. It what one of our best souvenir in Mexico. Thanks a lot for everything...
Everything was perfect  : the waterfall, the campside, the cook and of course the guides.
We would have rate 6 stars in tripavisor...
Thomas Sandra Camille & Simon

486397596.name: Amazing!
486397596.author: a TripAdvisor user
486397596.reviewBody: This hidden little gem is just outside of Comitan. It\'s very easy to get to the office by collectivo and then you ride in the back of a pick up (with benches) out to the site. The falls themselves are absolutely incredible. The whole staff is super friendly and helpful and the experience is a full power nature immersion. Incredible! We had a blast and can not recommend this place enough. If you are in comitan it is well worth the visit!

483753435.name: Magical adventure
483753435.author: a TripAdvisor user
483753435.reviewBody:
One-in-a-lifetime adventure with Angel, Cesar, Adrian and Juan-the most passionate guides you will meet !

On board of a truck, we embarked on a journey that will stay in our hearts forever ! After a few kilometers we entered a private land where we began to walk down to the river. Bathing suits and shoes on, and ready to dive in the water !! 
We followed the three waterfalls (gorgeous views!) and jumped from a 7m one! The adventure continued and we went behind beautiful water curtains to discover a small cave where bats and birds come to cool down. We also took mud baths and admired the breath-taking view from the 45m waterfall at the end of the path. What. A. Day. 
And to make sure you remember this day to the fullest, Angel gives you all pictures and videos taken during the trip!! 

I cannot thank them enough for this wonderful experience !! 
I encourage everyone to experience the 3 Tzimoleras, I guarantee you won't regret it !!

454494588.name: Beautiful and peaceful, best camping experience you will have in Chiapas
454494588.author: a TripAdvisor user
454494588.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful place with excellent service. I will recount the trip and what we did. We were seven friends, five of them live in San Cristibal and my husband and I live in New York. We lived in San Cristobal years ago but we come often to this part of the world. 
The trip starts in Simoleras, a small town where you can leave your car and get on a 4 wheel drive. You have to travel through corn fields and Angel and Quinie, the team leaders, will give you a historical summary of the origin of the name as well as the story of the ranch itself where the waterfall is located. You have to walk to get to your camp, which only adds to the adventurous spirit of this experience.
We came to the Tres Simoleras under the recommendation of one of our friends. We planned the trip within a week and were excited to go. We found a wonderful group of young people who are eager to do things right. Angel, Quinie, Luis Antonio and Adrian are deeply committed to making your stay wonderful and safe. As a point of reference, I have to say that we a were all in our late fifties, sixties and even seventies. A member of the group had a knee replacement a few years back. The safety equipment and the care this group of young people showed was remarkable.
Tres Simoleras is a stunning place. It has two beautiful sites in which you can camp, we stayed in the one right beside the waterfall. The water is blue and transparent, the waterfall magnificently beautiful. The sky at night is covered with stars. We went swimming and it was a beautiful experience. If you are more adventurous (and younger), the team can take you to a place where you can jump into the water (seven meter jump), and go up the mountain and see the waterfall from above. There are a number of tracks you can follow, but we stayed in our camping site and went swimming, enjoying its magnificent beauty and peacefulness.
You will not regret going. It is a stunning place and a wonderful camping experience that Angel, Adrain, Quinie, and Luis Antonio will adapt to your needs. You will not be disappointed.

440142562.name: Hands down, best experience in Chiapas!
440142562.author: a TripAdvisor user
440142562.reviewBody: I cannot recommend this place more. We visited lots of beautiful places in Chiapas, but nothing was as what we experienced in Las 3 Tzimoleras. Communication was fast and easy with our guide, Angel. He met us at the park and had truly Chiapaneca breakfast at his lovely mum\'s house. Soon we were off but not before Angel\'s mum packed us a nutritious, truly local lunch called "chin-ku-hua-khes" made of handmade tortillas and beans, and drink of the Mayan gods, corn "pozol"! Angel gave us a running commentary as we drove through the mountains and stopped for us to take pictures. Once we got there, the waterfalls were just beautiful. The forest is very tranquil and you\'ll be the only people there. We walked and swam in/along the river where Angel challenged us to leap off cascades, big and small\u2026then one very big one! I\'m so glad I did it! We swam some more and just absorbed the power of the falls, then relaxed around a fire built by Angel, swinging off hammocks as the sun went down. I\'d definitely go back again but next time I\'m packing my tent to spend a few nights there! Thank you Angel!

439152973.name: Breath-taking views, a rush of adrenaline!
439152973.author: a TripAdvisor user
439152973.reviewBody: Just getting there is a great adventure. You will be taken on a 4x4 on a bumpy ride on a dirt-track, going through local corn fields and a picturesque forest. If you\'re lucky, like we were, you could spot some wildlife like owl and wild deer! We only did the one day trip but it looks like a really great camping spot with clean, ecological toilets and firewood. The river is an amazing turquoise and the waterfalls just beautiful. Really recommending jumping off the 1st waterfall!!! It was exhilarating and liberating! The guides were very friendly and always ensured our safety and comfort. They pointed out different plants and animal prints to us. Definitely will come back again and spend a night or two!

456493244.name: Lugar tranquilo y de bajo costo!! Excelente para los que aman la naturaleza
456493244.author: a TripAdvisor user
456493244.reviewBody: Lugar muy cerca de Comit\u00e1n!! El centro del lugar hay pozas donde nace el agua y si caminas hay muchas pozas y palapas durante todo el lugar! Se encuentran muchos balnearios cerca! Hotel y restaurantes de dos estrellas! A 3 kilometros adelante esta la laguna de koila  donde puedes llegar con botes y practicar deportes no motorizados! (No hay botes en renta! Debes llevarlo) y 3 kil\u00f3metros antes de llegar hay una entrada al cenote de chicumaltik realmente hermosos! Tienes que visitarlos!!!! Al llegar te cobran una entrada porque los administran los ejidatarios pero es poco! En Semana Santa hacen fiestas en algunas propiedades para todo el p\u00fablico!! El lugar est\u00e1 lleno de propiedades con alberca!!!

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

451712351.name: lugar para nadar
451712351.author: a TripAdvisor user
451712351.reviewBody: pozas de agua dulce ubicadas en el municipio de comitan de domiguez en ele estado de chiapas, un buen lugar para disfrutar en familia

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

344386360.name: Un lindo lugar
344386360.author: a TripAdvisor user
344386360.reviewBody: Solo pase por ah\u00ed, pero se ve que es un lugar muy tranquilo donde se puede pasar un lindo d\u00eda nadando. Lo que m\u00e1s me gusto fue lo cristalino de sus aguas, realmente es dif\u00edcil de creer.

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

274527654.name: UN OASIS EN EL DESIERTO
274527654.author: a TripAdvisor user
274527654.reviewBody: es un lugar ideal para descansar, encuentras todo lo que quieras, el agua es limpia y refrescante, no es fria no es calida, hay comida cerca y economica, el clima es templado, el ambiente familiar, muy cerca de Comitan. me encanta ir a Uninajab, si vienes a Comitan no olvides ir a Uninajab, quedaras encantado

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

249121416.name: No lo recomiendo.
249121416.author: a TripAdvisor user
249121416.reviewBody: Entre el Municipio de Comitan y las cascadas de "El Chiflon" esta este lugar, que por curiosidad llegue a visitar por el anuncio que exitia en la carretera, pero al llegar, no fue la gran cosa, unas aguas tipo alberca... peque\u00f1as...y con decorado de una plaza municipal, de inmediato se acercaron a cobrarme por el coche, pero al ver el lugar sinceramente no me llamo la atencion en lo mas minimo y opte por retirarme.  Sin lugar a dudas nada que ver despues de visitar el centro turistico "El Chiflon"

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

247856135.name: Familiar.
247856135.author: a TripAdvisor user
247856135.reviewBody: Es un balneario familiar, administrado por una cooperativa de ejidatarios, lo cual explica algunas de las carencias que tiene. No hay \u00e1rea de vestidores o regaderas, y el solo deseo de ir al ba\u00f1o resulta una complicaci\u00f3n. No obstante, los lugare\u00f1os son amables y se comen excelentes mojarras.

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

244162342.name: Un lugar bueno para  disfrutar en familia
244162342.author: a TripAdvisor user
244162342.reviewBody: Es un lugar en donde puedes respirar aire puro, disfrutar de la naturaleza de los arboles, las albercas para nadar y sobre todo un area para comer rico.

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

215728419.name: Lugar de piscinas!!!
215728419.author: a TripAdvisor user
215728419.reviewBody: Es un peque\u00f1o poblado con piscinas naturales. Se puede caminar bajando por la falda de la monta\u00f1a y seguir el viaje que hacen las aguas formando nuevas albercas.\nUn buen lugar para nadar y pasar una tarde disfrutando este sitio.\nComit\u00e1n es la ciudad mas cercana a este lugar y es la ruta que lleva a Cascadas el Chifl\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

179268783.name: Un paseo agradable
179268783.author: a TripAdvisor user
179268783.reviewBody: Otro atractivo cercano a Comit\u00e1n, vale la pena ir en fin de semana o en el verano, para nadar y pasar un d\u00eda agradable en este sitio. Hay transporte p\u00fablico, muy econ\u00f3mico, o si cuenta con auto, est\u00e1 a menos de 40 min de distancia.

address.streetAddress: A 12 km de Comitan

530948300.name: No lo recomiendo
530948300.author: a TripAdvisor user
530948300.reviewBody: La verdad esperaba otra cosa por lo qie dicen del lugar. Asi que amigos que nos visitan piensenlo bien hay ottas opciones

address.streetAddress: 2A Av. Poniente Sur Corner with Calle Central Poniente

672299961.name: Just Ok.  The best of the lakes is at Tziscao
672299961.author: a TripAdvisor user
672299961.reviewBody: I\'ve been many times taking guests.  The park is divided into a federal side and an Ejido side.  The federal side is to the left and perhaps a bit more natural.  Sometimes they charge at a booth.  But the road is also the principal highway to the Chiapas state SE border with Guatemala.  So just say you\'re going right to Palenque (7 hours) and there is no charge.  We usually just do the one at Tziscao.  Occasional we take people in the back way from Comit\u00e1n to the federal side. Just as you enter there by the stream bridge the is an interesting trail taking you to an arch and some caves.  The stream comes OUT of the nearby lake and disappears just after the arch into the cave system.  In Tziscao it\'s a bit more interesting.  They have all services and you can swim in the lake.  At the end there\'s a pedestrian entrance to Guatemala and some artisan stalls.  It\'s a great picture standing on the line and seeing the divided lake just below.  Don\'t forget to look at the coffee trees growing just behind you.  Lagos de Montebello it\'s a small coffee growing region though hard hit by the La Roya leaf blight.

644564866.name: Gorgeous
644564866.author: a TripAdvisor user
644564866.reviewBody: The entrance it\u2019s a little complicate but the view and trip around the lake are amazing. You must have to.

640683214.name: Stunning waters
640683214.author: a TripAdvisor user
640683214.reviewBody: The visit here was definitely worth every penny. The lakes range from a deep blue to green. There is also some really good street food nearby which is cheap and of a great quality. The lakes themselves are beautiful in colour and the views that are provided.

635903834.name: Beautiful landscape but not worth a long journey
635903834.author: a TripAdvisor user
635903834.reviewBody: We visited the lakes from Comitan. Unfortunately the day was not great, but the lake were beautiful anyway. However, not that much to do besides the nice landscapes. We ended up getting in and out of the car just to take a few pictures. Apparently you can only swim in Montebello lake. So all in all we were happy to have an accommodation in Comitan and not in Tziscao. Still worth a visit if you have time

608454770.name: A Splash of Colors
608454770.author: a TripAdvisor user
608454770.reviewBody: I had seen Lagunas de Montebello only in maps and pics before the trip and I was just overwhelmed with joy when I got there finally. I had never seen water so clean in a lake, I drank water straight from the lake and it tasted like Earth and pureness. The boat ride was amazing and it made me conscious about the reality that people live in the south of Mexico.

587107341.name: Beautiful Place
587107341.author: a TripAdvisor user
587107341.reviewBody: For 25MXP you enter to a forest surrounded of beautiful lakes. Main lakes in my opinion are 5 Lakes, Pojoj, Tziscao. At Pojoj you can take a trip to an small island in a logs balsa and swim and dive. there is the only place to swim 100Mxp p/p or longest trip includes a visit other small lake 150Mxp. I didn\u2019t do it as part of a tour. I rented a  driver an stay in rustic cabin inside park At Tziscao Lake. Quiet place. We walked to Guatemalan border . A lot of typical food is from Guatemala there.\nYou are not going to find world class amenities, but great people that lives from their services.

577668469.name: Day trip from San Cristobal
577668469.author: a TripAdvisor user
577668469.reviewBody: I took a day tour to Montebello and Chiflon with the Viajes y Hoteles company from San Cristobal. The cost was 350 Pesos whereas the other companies offer it for 300. I wanted to give this company a try as it seems the one that is more popular with the hostels. Anyhow both Chiflon and Montebello was good. The price is only for the transportation and some entrance fees. There is no information provided whatsoever. No english. The only thing that the drive kept repeating is that we have to tip the guides at Chiflon. By the was it is ridiculous to take a guide at Chiflon as you just stare at water falling. In Montebello you make 4 stops of 15 minutes at certain location. Just enough time to take a picture and go to the toilet. The Journey is quite long. If you want to "see" the lakes - it is OK, but if you want to enjoy it - you better take your time with another multiple day tour...The day tour lasted 13hours.

566165360.name: lovely and natural
566165360.author: a TripAdvisor user
566165360.reviewBody: these lagoons are amazing, super natural and clean, not much to do but look at them, but seems there are horses to ride and shops too

540438186.name: Very long drive - not fantastic without sun
540438186.author: a TripAdvisor user
540438186.reviewBody: We had read about the Lagunas and it was part of our tour on the same day that we visited El Chiflon (which was great).  This is very far when you are staying in San Cristobal.  If the sun is not shining, the colours of the lakes are not so special.  We would have prepared less driving and spending more time at the waterfall.

508895934.name: Historical and Natural Beauty
508895934.author: a TripAdvisor user
508895934.reviewBody: The water is clear blue. The lagoon is made up of many lagoons feeding from one another. This place is maintained by the indigenous population and the government is constantly monitoring to make sure it\'s kept clean. There are many wild orchids hanging from the walls.\nThe local cacao or bitter chocolate is very good to buy as well as coffee. Guatemala is only a couple steps away for any continued adventure.

504325909.name: Spectacular
504325909.author: a TripAdvisor user
504325909.reviewBody: This reserve is really cool.  Views are breathtaking.  Surrounded by forest and nature they really make you feel good.

502183286.name: Beautiful
502183286.author: a TripAdvisor user
502183286.reviewBody: A lot of beautiful lakes with diferent water colors and great sights. Must visit. Lot of local places to eat nearby but not so good. \n

490834413.name: Nice Colorful Water
490834413.author: a TripAdvisor user
490834413.reviewBody: The lakes are beautiful.  Lots of flowers, as well.  Good camping at a couple of them.  There are also some other lakes offering free camping.  Ask the locals for the locations.  They will share.

476272951.name: Worth the looking drive
476272951.author: a TripAdvisor user
476272951.reviewBody: What a beautiful place, despite being 2-3 hours south of San Cristobal you need to come to this place if you are a photographer or videographer. For you Drone lovers, this is a place to fly and take high aerial pictures. You will need to pay a price but negotiate it down to 500 pesos for two lakes and you come back home with amazing footage!\n\nOnly back draw: There is way too much people and it can become uncomfortable, try going during the week or spend time in the less visited lakes.

473012828.name: VARIETY OF COLORS
473012828.author: a TripAdvisor user
473012828.reviewBody: The lakes are beautiful: each one is a different shade of green or blue. Each one has a distinct look. There are boats on some of the lakes; food and crafts at others. Worth a visit.

440247428.name: Great lakes.
440247428.author: a TripAdvisor user
440247428.reviewBody: Pretty lakes in some decent lacandon jungle. We just passed through and drove around a little, although I wish we would have camped here a few days.

391897302.name: have to see it to belive it
391897302.author: a TripAdvisor user
391897302.reviewBody: There is so much beauty here, the color of the water of the lakes has many shades of turquoise , and when you see that surrounded by a deep forest you\'ll immediately feel the power of nature all around you

387968881.name: Nature at its best, Lagunas de Montebello
387968881.author: a TripAdvisor user
387968881.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our trip along the Lagunos de Montebello. The colours of each lake is different, size and depth of the lakes matter there. Lago Pojo is really nice: we took the boat tour to a little island in the centre of the lake where they have an ample collection of orchids of the region.

387624984.name: Amazing view
387624984.author: a TripAdvisor user
387624984.reviewBody: I definitely recommend visiting the lagunas de Montebello. The paddle ride cost 100 pesos the short trip to the island or 150 pesos the longer trip to see the cenote. I recommend the short trip, the cenote you can\'t go in, and this way you have more time to swim at the island. \nThe water at the island is Cristal blue, absolutely beautiful and the water is not too cold. \nWear your swimsuit from the beginning or change in the bathroom because there is no place to change in the island.

372751598.name: Worth the effort
372751598.author: a TripAdvisor user
372751598.reviewBody: Most people visit this national park during a long day trip from San Crist\u00f3bal. It\'s worth the effort, as you pass the ceramic village of Amatenango and the Maya ruins of Chinkultic and see a nice part of Chiapas. The national park itself is not spectacular, but the lakes are nice and it\'s a very green area, close to the border with Guatemala.

361925513.name: Excellent view, a lot of misinformation
361925513.author: a TripAdvisor user
361925513.reviewBody:
I think that this place is an amazing natural destination, the view is magnificent and the climate great too.
The bad part is that there is little information available for tourists and several fees to pay... Once you arrive to the National Park there is an Official Government booth $1.7 USD per person (it includes nothing just the permission to see 1 lake), next thing you have a ton of people asking for money: pseudo guides, kids, official guides, informal businesses etc. 
If you want to see the other 4 lakes, you have to pay again... now $1.4 USD to a "Union" that runs the place.
I am Mexican and I am sincerely ashamed that this Natural beauty is so poorly managed by either the Government and the "Union of the Ejido". Tourists from around the world visit this place and the only information available are the fees to pay and a vanished poster.
My suggestion is to rent a car, arrive as early as possible, and do the tour by yourself.

359216282.name: Beautiful Lakes
359216282.author: a TripAdvisor user
359216282.reviewBody: The place is just next to Guatemala and around 3 hours drive from San Cristobal de las casas. Excellent place to enjoy your vaccations. The place has over 50 lakes and some of them are worth visiting. You can also do kayaking and visit some islands in the middle of lakes. You can also visit the artisans market on the other side of border in Guatemala. You can book tour package from San cristobal. It cost about 350 peso. Be careful of some tour agencies which have some partnership with some local restaurants and the drivers end up stopping at many places for food and you end up having no time to enjoy the lakes.( it happened with me, so be careful)

358337403.name: Beautiful lakes
358337403.author: a TripAdvisor user
358337403.reviewBody: These are beautiful lakes very close to Guatemala. The best part of the tour for me was to take the wooden rafts around the lakes and swim. We were offered a shorter ride or a longer one that allows for the swim and a walk at the end of the lake that has great views over another cenote-like lake.  Take the long one and a bath! Water is very clean and its temperature was great in March.

347861352.name: Nice hiking
347861352.author: a TripAdvisor user
347861352.reviewBody: We got there by collectivo and got a guide for 500 pesos.  Very cold day saw a couple of the lakes. Agree that they are not really spectacular. We got our guide to take us on a 2 hour hike starting at lake Pojoj which was great and quite strenuous\n Got some great Vistas at the end.  On a sunny day it would have been beautiful. Bring warm clothing. ..it was 14C the day we were there. The walk over to Guatemala was also fun.

335817166.name: An easy trip from Comitan
335817166.author: a TripAdvisor user
335817166.reviewBody: I left very early to avoid crowds. And in the beginning I was completely alone in the park. I took a path from Laguna pojoj to cinco lagunas. It was awesome, there was nobody there, just orchids and stunning views of different lakes. It is worth staying for a day.

331006776.name: Beautiful. tranquil and tasty!
331006776.author: a TripAdvisor user
331006776.reviewBody: The little lakes are adorable, and everywhere you go you can taste delicious Chiapaneco country food from Platanos Fritas (fried Platains) to Queso Fundido (melted cheese, usually in banana leaf!). Great for a day of lazying about and munching! We took a day tour from San Cristobal. The guide spoke Spanish only, but we enjoyed it nonetheless.

311556024.name: Amazing place!!! A must in Chiapas!!!
311556024.author: a TripAdvisor user
311556024.reviewBody: There are no words to describe this place; you need to go there and see it by yourself. Its so quiet and peaceful; I would recommend a tour (you can take them from San Cristobal) for less than $30USD. Those guys (the tourist agencies) know where to go. If you have a chance you can take a boat (very basic and old) and move around the lake. The blue colors are amazing, and I will recommend go there during afternoon, no so late, but before 6pm or something, so you will be able to appreciate all

298561265.name: A wonderful day trip in Chiapas.
298561265.author: a TripAdvisor user
298561265.reviewBody: This National Park is a must during your visit in southern state of Chiapas. It\'s a wonderful day trip if your hotel is in San Cristobal. Several lagoons with several blue colors, this place will make you appreciate the wonders of nature. The National Park has a shared administration - half of them by the Federal Goverment - start with this side and then finish with the other half - which is under the care of local people. You can find places to eat traditional food (extremely cheap and very tasty). There\'s one lagoon where you can swim, so if you want to, be prepared.

297358938.name: One of the best experiences ever
297358938.author: a TripAdvisor user
297358938.reviewBody: My girlfriend and I went to Montebello and we were a bit concerned about the roads because the bad comments on here, I just wanna let you know guys that these roads are in mint condition, no potholes,no rocks, yes some curves like any other Mexican road but you won\'t die buddy! Those little curves will make your trip worth it 110%. These lakes are just a piece of art and haven\'t seen anything better than them. If you ever get the chance to visit, make sure you do the canoe adventure ($250 pesos each). A guide will take you on a Mayan man built canoe through the five lakes giving you details on the history and answers any questions you may have. He will also stop for twenty minutes to allow you to swim in the beautiful lake of changing colours. This is a must see excursion! Highly recommended ! \nTip: don\'t get a guide from the roads outside the national park, get a guide once you pay your entrance fee to the park\nThumbs up if you like my comment!!!

295381580.name: One of the most stunning places I have ever been to!
295381580.author: a TripAdvisor user
295381580.reviewBody: The serenity of this place is incredible! I have traveled quite a bit and have rarely witnessed this level of beauty mother nature has to offer. Pictures simply do not do this place justice. We were there while it was raining (apparently it always rains here) and for a moment while we were up on the hill looking down, I stopped feeling the rain and was overtaken by the jaw-dropping views. As exaggerated as this might seem, I am serious, if you\u00b4re nearby do not let the opportunity pass to come see this!\n\nIf you like my review, thumbs up!

294547630.name: Go by yourself to see them all
294547630.author: a TripAdvisor user
294547630.reviewBody: I did a tour of these lakes, but only really saw two out of the many that are there. The tour was organized from San Cristobal de las Casas, but it would have been better for us to get a bus there and then the mini taxis that we saw on the road. We did a 40min row on one lake for 150 pesos each that was quite fun. All up, because I went on a tour, I could see some beautiful lakes but did not see the variety that I have read exists in this national park.

285763639.name: Ignore the rain, enjoy the views/
285763639.author: a TripAdvisor user
285763639.reviewBody: My husband and I come to Chiapas every three months (renewing US Visas) and this was our first time to Los Lagos de Montebello.  They are smaller than I expected, but they are so very beautiful!!  It was cold and rainy the whole time we were there, but it was an unexpected and fairly rare cold front from up north that we just happened to hit.  \n\nThe land is beautiful, the mountains are a sight to behold, and the people are friendly.  There is an excellent archeological site nearby with the best food I have ever eaten (queso fundido) and we had a great time.  We stayed at the nearby Lake Tziscao, which we loved.  Going back soon, I promise.

283217573.name: M\u00e1gic
283217573.author: a TripAdvisor user
283217573.reviewBody: This place has been my favorit over everything I saw in Chiapas. The colors of the warer are beautiful and all the place around is so clean. We hired a guide there in the entrance of the lagunas, he took us to five of them and we made a canoe tour in the bigest laguna, that was sooo relaxing, it is a canoe of wood. We deove around, made a small walke to another laguna and than we had the chance to get in to the laguna, it was so refreshing and even the small fishes were biting my feet. We went then to the border with Guatemala and took some fotos on the other side. \n\nThe guide told us that a tour going to Lagunas de montebello, las nubes, las guacamayas and than selva lacandona is posible (i did not find anything on the internet about this, i wanted to donexactly that tour). There are eco caba\u00f1as to sleep. We bought a organic Cafe, Tziscao, tastes very good!

278889633.name: Lagunas de Montebello - an affair to remember!!!!
278889633.author: a TripAdvisor user
278889633.reviewBody: Chiapas is one of my favorites estates in Mexico, full of color, magic, amazing sightseens thought the entire estate and Lagunas de Montebello is a symphony of beauty among Nature.

277106085.name: Explore the magical Lakes of Montebello
277106085.author: a TripAdvisor user
277106085.reviewBody:
The Lakes of Montebello are an amazing experience if you take the time to really enjoy them. Swimming, kayaking, hiking and exploring caves are all wonderful possibilities: even just admiring the different colors of the lakes from the road on a sunny day is a treat. We usually stay at the Ecolodge in Tziscao, but there are other small hotels and cabins by the Tziscao lake as well. 
If you enjoy hiking, it is a good idea to hire a guide (the managers of the Ecolodge can put you in touch with honest and knowledgeable ones) and take any one of many treks through the jungle to see bromeliads, orchids, hidden cenotes and Mayan bas-reliefs carved on the rocks. The views of the different lakes are spectacular.  While one lake, La Encantada, has unfortunately been polluted, the lakes in the newer area of the park (taking the road to the right after the entrance booth) are pristine.  Pojoj, Tziscao and Cinco Lagos are particularly entrancing, with coves and islands to explore by kayak, raft or swimming. The lookout point above Cinco Lagos is blessed with a view worthy of a fantasy novel, and the stairs up to it are wedged between tiny restaurants with delicious local quesadillas, tamales, cheeses, chocolate and coffee. You can also buy some Guatemalan beer or sweets, and if you like them, take a 30 minute walk from the Ecolodge to the Guatemalan border, where you can pop across with no problem and shop for local crafts, Gallo beer or the tasty chiclosos (caramels).  
If you are fascinated with the mysteries of sacred caves, take the road that goes straight beyond the entrance booth, park at the last parking lot and walk down the dirt road behind it to Paso del Soldado: a bridge over a little stream.  On the right just before you get to the bridge, there is a path that leads uphill to a huge natural arch and a smaller path that will take you to a stunning cave with glimmering green water at the bottom and sacred stalagmites adorned with ribbons and votive candles. 
The only caveat about this park is, don't try to see it all from a bus on a 4 hour tour.  You, and the Lakes, deserve better than that. Spend at least one night there to enjoy the place to the fullest.

277086968.name: Good, but not overwhelming
277086968.author: a TripAdvisor user
277086968.reviewBody: Beautiful lakes. But there\'s more beautiful ones to be found elsewhere. It\'s a nice getaway for a few hours. And on some tours you can even cross the boarder to Nicaragua for a few meters without any passport-control. But apart from that not a must-see.

276733908.name: Pure nature in its entirety expression.
276733908.author: a TripAdvisor user
276733908.reviewBody: Love this place. Calm and quiet, the wind blows gentle. Enormous lakes. Beautiful landscapes. Tip go early before 11 am.

271016441.name: Organised tours are tourist traps
271016441.author: a TripAdvisor user
271016441.reviewBody: The landscape is awsome but the organised tours where awefull. The car stops at about 5 different lookouts just to take a picture and drives on. The only stop where you have an hour time is at a lagune where the only thing you could do was an ride with a wooden boad to an island just to take some pictures again. Its quit expensive and there is nothing else you can do at this stop. \nIf you want to see the lagunes you better rent a car and do it on your own.

270225200.name: Beautiful National Park!!
270225200.author: a TripAdvisor user
270225200.reviewBody: This park with its various lakes has astonishing and breath taking views, each Lake holds different vegetation and fish, differes a bit in its surroundings and offerings. Some have restaurants along side and others have canoeing and other activities. It is important you pay for a guide and there is an entrance fee, which includes all Lakes. In this place, I only find the road to be difficult.

266144996.name: Lovely lakes
266144996.author: a TripAdvisor user
266144996.reviewBody: Lovely and colorful lakes only a 45 minutes drive from Comitan. Note that there are two groups of lakes: the "older" lakes if you go straight after the park entrance (inclusive in the park entrance fee) and the "new" lakes at the right turn (for a separate fee good for all of them). Dont miss the Cinque Lagos (new group). Swimming is possible in some of the lakes and rafting on others. There are also pony rides to special sites. Guides are available but by planning ahead you can get along without a guide. Like in many parks in Chiapas you\'re required to pay two seperate entry fees.

262022526.name: nice but not mindblowing
262022526.author: a TripAdvisor user
262022526.reviewBody: Quite nice lakes but probably stunning only a clear blue day. Some sort of a racket running whereby you pay twice- once at an official looking place, and then again at little shacks everytime you go to a lake. One of the lakes was a bit polluted.

260973954.name: Lotsa lakes
260973954.author: a TripAdvisor user
260973954.reviewBody: Lots a lakes and very pretty. But nothing to do but look. You can hire a ride on native log rafts but not for us 70+ folks. Too much driving for the viewing of Guatemala on the other side of the lakes

260743898.name: (Literally) breathtaking swimming
260743898.author: a TripAdvisor user
260743898.reviewBody:
We stayed at community-tourism hotel EcoTziscao and got a guide from there. Personally I'd focus on swimming and watersports: it's nice to look at the lakes, and it is amazing that they have different colours, but being in the water is so much better than looking at it. The little museum is also nice. 
We swam off the balsa raft in Cinco Lagos and off a kayak in Lago Tziscao. The water is deep and clear and clean and cold, and it feels almost like it's pressing in on you from all sides... in a pleasant way. Bring swimming goggles and dive around and marvel at the blueness of the lake and check out the bottom of your raft. If you have a wetsuit or something that helps you hold out against the cold, all the better. We were lucky to hit a sunny day and warmed up afterwards: bring a sweater. 
Another day we rented kayaks at Hotel EcoTziscao and paddled around the lake: also amazing. Lake Tziscao flooded on New Year's Day 2015 and when we went, Feb 2015, the water was still very high. This obviously makes it all the more important that tourists come and spend money at the community-run hotel, so go for it: the flooding doesn't disturb the hotel except for making the lawn a bit squishy. It was also a pretty surreal experience to kayak out across bushes and hedges and picnic tables. We explored the other side of the lake and swam some more (still amazing) which made for a thoroughly enjoyable Sunday morning, followed by a solid breakfast in the sun. 
It's worth mentioning that the Lagunas de Montebello tourism operation is run by the local ejido (communal land-owning system) and the profits go to the community, who in turn look after the lakes' environment and each other.

259502523.name: GREEN!
259502523.author: a TripAdvisor user
259502523.reviewBody: Most of the lakes there according to the guide are virgin lakes since they dont use motorboats, but logs all tide up together and a paddle to get to your location. It was a very nice expeirence and the local people take care of their land.

252748262.name: Beautiful green area
252748262.author: a TripAdvisor user
252748262.reviewBody: We came by car to the national park. At the entrance of the park there are some tourist guides waiting for you. You have to take an official guide with you in the car. We had a wonderful guide that day who used to live inside the park next to the border with guatemala. He took us to some of the most scenic places i\'d seen so far in chiapas, Really wonderful views on the different lakes, Finally he took us to his old village and the border of Guatemala. Great times there

249035680.name: Amazing!!!!
249035680.author: a TripAdvisor user
249035680.reviewBody: This is the "must see" of Chiapas! The park has a huge set of lakes, each one with a beauty and spectacular views. The water is clear, shades ranging from light blue to dark green, with sumptuous vegetation. Unfortunately I was there in a cold weather and it was not possible to swim in any lake, but you can do this if you want.

243001730.name: a Must!!!
243001730.author: a TripAdvisor user
243001730.reviewBody: You haven\u00b4t seen water this color. These are five lagoons with amazing crystalline water. You can navigate the five of them in very rustic boats. Some tips are to arrive early, avoid going on weekends and also to grab a swimming suit to swim in this amazing place.

240846627.name: Wow!
240846627.author: a TripAdvisor user
240846627.reviewBody:
Again, all the pictures are not enough to really describe this place!

We took our own car from Comitan; it was faster, cheaper, we could stay as long as we wanted in each lagoon and best of all, all the vendors ignored us to go sell their stuff to the big tour busses ja ja ja!

The drive was pretty safe, we payed a small fee for the wrist band in the park check point and also an other fee in the first lagoon "Miramar" which included a booklet with tickets to the rest of the lagoons... OMG nothing really prepares you when you first glimpse the deep blue among the pine trees!!! (I had to scream it was so blue!!).

Feel free to visit all 5 lagoons, you can swim in all and go on raft rides (about $400 pesos p/p) which I highly recommend because you can experience the whole thing and the pictures have no equal.

Also make the effort to visit "laguna internacional" right next to the biggest lake's village, it borders Guatemala. There are no dangers here, only tourists and some guatemalan vendors, it's fun to play being in two countries at the same time! also they sell the tastiest food for pennies.

240713415.name: DREAM LAND OMG
240713415.author: a TripAdvisor user
240713415.reviewBody:
guys , this is a place you should never miss, but not like us, allow it sufficient time, and do take an official guide on spot that should cost you something between 120-150 pesos, but he will be able to show you the best ways to view the highlghts of the so many splendid lagoons. so beautiful so relaxed, a true paradise ! just do it easy, and enjoy the beauty and the majestic views.
MAMA MIA QUE BELLO !!!
FINALLY
the better way to get there, which we learned after arriving from palenque, is taking the border road with guatemala, and not the road via ococingo, which was blocked often by protestors, holding us "hostages" for hours, but check first. ENJOY!!!

238662446.name: Awesome!
238662446.author: a TripAdvisor user
238662446.reviewBody: It took an hr bus ride to get to Comitan from San Cristobal to get to this place and once you get off the bus you can find a little van that takes you to the place for 50pesos which was great considering I had my bike and all they did was just put it on the roof, the place was great. A group of different lakes you can go check out rent a canoe or in my case ride your bike to all of them until you find the one you can swim in. Take the public transport bus instead of an excursion, that way you have more time to do what you want and they are cheaper and will let you put your bike on the roof.

225989179.name: Beauty filled place!
225989179.author: a TripAdvisor user
225989179.reviewBody: Lots of lakes to visit, well taken care of. If offered the canoe ride, take it, by all means! Fresh air, clean water, if able to swim, do it, very fresh water! Great to know how clean it is! Relaxing, enchanting, comforting, great relation nature-happiness!

225887589.name: Seems unreal
225887589.author: a TripAdvisor user
225887589.reviewBody: Make sure you go on a sunny day to take a dip into turquoise waters, it is awesome how you can cross over to Guatemala with just a few steps. \nIt is absolutely stunning

217163027.name: Amazing place to enjoy nature
217163027.author: a TripAdvisor user
217163027.reviewBody: There are more than 50 lakes in this area and only one is really the Montebello lake but all are usually named as Montebello lakes. If you arrive by yourself to the entrance, is a good idea to hire a guide and arrange his rate in advance. For around US 25 he will guide you for about 4 - 5 hours to different lakes. I strongly recommend to go first to the area known as five lakes (cinco lagos), rent a kayak or enjoy a trip in a native boat and enjoy a superb swimming time in crystalline waters. Then you may go to the "international lake" when you will find an interesting open border between Mexico and Guatemala where you can buy souvenirs from Guatemala and even enter that country for some time without a passport. Finally you can visit the actual Montebello lake and some others. If you take a tour it will be important to know if they will give you enough time to swim and relax a little bit because this is not a place to visit in a hurry.

201419400.name: Border lakes
201419400.author: a TripAdvisor user
201419400.reviewBody: Natural reserve area recognized and protected by the government and well managed by local communities with the diversity of colours and flavors of mayan ancestry.

190942155.name: great lakes offer wonderful views
190942155.author: a TripAdvisor user
190942155.reviewBody: After 20 years I came back and still consider the site wonderful. Even if it was cloudy and raining we had a great time, and great pictures. Taking a row boat to cross  one of the lakes  was absolutely pleasant. Locals are proud of their place ant take care of it. Lakes are clean and no motor-boats allowed , at least in 2 of the lakes we visited. \nObviously after 20 years now you can find all sort of small mom and pops which sell you local chocolate, coffee, quesadillas grilled corn and others\n

189174546.name: Worth the visit!
189174546.author: a TripAdvisor user
189174546.reviewBody: The lagunas were wonderful - beautiful color with deep water and an opportunity to take a special wooden raft on one of the lakes - worth the visit and boat ride!

186477796.name: Surreal ...
186477796.author: a TripAdvisor user
186477796.reviewBody:
One of the most beautiful places I have ever been not just in Mexico but anywhere.

You gain entry to all of the major lakes for under 5 USD. The Cinco Lagos is amazing.

Definetely worth the drive from San Cristóbal de las Casas.

185353799.name: Great area
185353799.author: a TripAdvisor user
185353799.reviewBody: Loved having a tour guide to explain the lagoons to us.  Too bad he did not speak English but my friend translated for me.  Also enjoyed being able to cross over to Guatemala without customs.  Makes a great picture to show both countries.

184354859.name: very beautiful
184354859.author: a TripAdvisor user
184354859.reviewBody:
The lakes are amaizing. It is very beautiful to walk around, and after everty turn you have a new lake behind the hill. The colors are very imprresive as well.

However, I went there without a tour or any car, and it wasnt a good idea. It was hard to go from one lake to the other, and not very nice. I felt like a target for the people who sales there tour or attraction, it was very hard to get some peace there. 
Somebody recommnded here to go without o tour guide because of the time, but it took a lot of time to get there and to pass from one laguna to the other.

To do it alone (one person) was a little bit cheaper (like 80 pesos) but not a lot. Maybe it is different for more people...

171716703.name: Could do with more time there
171716703.author: a TripAdvisor user
171716703.reviewBody: I travelled to the Lagunas de Montebello as part of a tour. There\'s no doubt about it that this is a nice place to visit with beautiful lake sceneries. However we only got to visit 3/4 lakes with just a 15 minute time limit visiting each one. This made me feel disappointed as I felt that we could\'ve visited more lakes.
