That is the downside of joining a tour, when things are rushed and you only get to have little time in some places.\n\nBut, it\'s a beautiful place nonetheless and I reckon I would\'ve enjoyed it more if I travelled there independently and spent more time in the national park.

171419239.name: A must see location
171419239.author: a TripAdvisor user
171419239.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful lake I have ever seen. This is somewhere u must stop when visiting Chiapas or when ur near San Christobal or Comitan. Every place around it is a great place to eat. Don\'t leave without having a quesadilla, the best. At a certain lake u can cross over into guatemala briefly. This is a must see location. There are also cabins! I can\'t wait to go back and actually swim in the lake. :)

170079810.name: Just amazing
170079810.author: a TripAdvisor user
170079810.reviewBody: Beautiful place, each laguna has a different color and charm. Don\'t miss the internacional one where you can cross into Guatemala

167950600.name: Most beautiful place in Chiapas
167950600.author: a TripAdvisor user
167950600.reviewBody:
Most mexicans don't know of the existence of these lagoons. In a landscape more reminiscent of Northern Europe, you'll find several lagoons within a natural reserve with no human intervention near. 
It's far and it's a somewhat cumbersome trip, but totally worth it.

Most people don't know it, but you can camp in lake Tziscao (you can't camp in the other lakes).

147261152.name: Excellent Place
147261152.author: a TripAdvisor user
147261152.reviewBody: I will never forget this experience!! The colors and nature is amazing!! You can buy cofee and chocolate from Chiapas as well as fresh chese.

139339373.name: Get one of the guides
139339373.author: a TripAdvisor user
139339373.reviewBody: We picked up one of the guides who told us about each of the lakes.  One of them is really polluted, but the others are lovely.  The contrasts in colour is incredible

132604904.name: Incredibly beautiful part of the world
132604904.author: a TripAdvisor user
132604904.reviewBody: These lakes are really stunning and well worth a visit. We hired a car and stayed for 2 nights in a wonderful little cabana right on the water at lake Tziscao. The lakes are all really close together making it easy to visit a lot of them, which is worthwhile because they are all very different. There are plenty of good places to swim and we also enjoyed a great walk rom the Bosque Azul car park through the forrest to some caves alongside a river; incredible scenery. Not sure how rewarding a day trip tour would be, think it\'s best to spend some time there to really enjoy this spectacular region.

116663905.name: FANTASTIC must-see natural lakes
116663905.author: a TripAdvisor user
116663905.reviewBody:
This was hands-down the best "attraction" I have seen in Chiapas outside of the Palenque-Agua Azul-Misol-Ha trio. Really lovely, beautiful clean water, gorgeous views and so nice to swim there (finally somewhere to swim in freshwater in Mexico!).

Sadly we couldn't hire a car so were trapped on a tour from San Cristóbal de las Casas. The major downside to the tour being that they took us to El Chiflon first - FOR 3 HOURS - and then we only had limited time (maybe 1.5 hours) at the Lagunas. In my opinion, El Chiflon warrants only an hour and the rest of the time should be spent at the Lagunas. The other thing about the tour (all of them are the same by the way) was that we were told we could swim at El Chiflon (yuk - cold and silty) but NOT at the Lagunas. This is NOT TRUE. Once we were at Laguna Pojoj (the one with the small island in the middle that they raft people out to) we asked if we could swim, and they told us we could. So we swam out to the island and back in beautiful, clear, fresh water. BLISS.

I liked it so much I am going back to Comitan to spend a few more days there, just to swim every day!

116446809.name: A lot of water
116446809.author: a TripAdvisor user
116446809.reviewBody: I don\'t remember how many laggons are here but I think there were over 30, we just visit 6 of them because we tried to enjoy them. They have awesome views so you cannot seee them all in one day unless you visit them very fast.

672293167.name: Well run by the local ejido and worth the entry fee.
672293167.author: a TripAdvisor user
672293167.reviewBody: These are some of the best high waterfalls in the state.  Paved walking paths, a variety of cabins, a very small assortment of artisan stuff (unlike the overwhelming push in other places), nice camping and swimming, and appropriately sized and maintained make this a must see.  Perfect for families.  It does require an uphill walk of about 1K but it\'s not difficult and has firm handrails.  There\'s a very nice Zipline.  Not a lot of food variety so bring a picnic unless junk food suits you.  I live nearby and frequently take guests.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

671022257.name: Great views
671022257.author: a TripAdvisor user
671022257.reviewBody:
Best to do the mirador first, then take boat ride
Remember the sunblock 

We drove our car and this took almost 4 hours total

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

655268158.name: Well worth it
655268158.author: a TripAdvisor user
655268158.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to spend the day. There are vendors if your hungry or need a drink. It\'s beautiful and in the budget

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

645866659.name: Stunning falls!
645866659.author: a TripAdvisor user
645866659.reviewBody: We spent 2-3 hours at this waterfall! Very nice half day trip. Walk up to the falls and make sure to stop by each fall lookout point. Once at the top, you can zipline down to the bottom - it was fun, but not nearly as long as some other ziplines around Mexico. There were about 5 ziplines from the top to the bottom.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

644582784.name: Hermoso
644582784.author: a TripAdvisor user
644582784.reviewBody: The access is difficult but is well worth seeing, you have to walk 1 km to get into the principal waterfall but is incredible.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

643634227.name: Cascada el Chiflon
643634227.author: a TripAdvisor user
643634227.reviewBody: Cascada el Chiflon \nThis is a place where you can connect with nature and enjoy the food; there is also a zip line at the top and you can go all the way down something that I do recommend to do the food is also delicious.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

640683478.name: The bluest water!
640683478.author: a TripAdvisor user
640683478.reviewBody: The waters in this region are a piercing blue that makes for an incredibly stunning photo. This is all before arriving at the main waterfall itself and there are many more opportunities than to just see the waterfalls!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

639141902.name: water lots of beautiful falling water

We regretted not to have organised a proper picnic! It was very easy to get there from Comitan and it was much less crowded than expected. Enjoy and take your time!

Most of the places don\'t have enough of either. This place does. i mean they have a visible cleanliness difference with other places, i\'m not saying there\'s not rubbish but the amount of bins is appropiate for the size.

601876554.name: Gorgeous
601876554.author: a TripAdvisor user
601876554.reviewBody:
Very beautiful.  Highly recommend.
Wish we had done this only and not also sumidero canyon.
There are guides when you first turn in.  We didn't hire one.  Happy with this decision... We saw them setting a fast pace for others.
When you get to the top of the main path, there are additional guides you can hire to go to the very top of the falls.  This is off limits without a guide.  By that point we were tired and didn't go all the way.
The water is very cold but just jump in.  They say not to swim after the first falls.  But there is one spot where it is safe and the locals were in.  It is a natural infinity pool that is phenomenal.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

594118018.name: Amazing waterfalls called \u201cVelo de Novia\u201d (Bride\u2019s Veil)
594118018.author: a TripAdvisor user
594118018.reviewBody: This is one of the most amazing irresistible places to know how good is your stamina and to test your condition. A lot of climbing but ALL IS WORTH IT!!! You can bring food, eat there and take it as a walk in the park with amazing view.

586870563.name: Beautiful place
586870563.author: a TripAdvisor user
586870563.reviewBody: The color of water is beautiful; 3 falls were you can take photos of amazing views, place have some altitude and the way is 1 km or more than half mile uphill with a path with many stairs, most under big trees to get to the amazing \u201c Velo de novia\u201d is an amazing visit, we take right path. There is 2 entrances and right have tirolesas. Restaurant food was good Chicken mlianesa and tostadas.. We swim on river. You can bring snacks and sit on one of multiples tables.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

556395235.name: Keep this one on your bucket list absolutely must see
556395235.author: a TripAdvisor user
556395235.reviewBody: This was on my bucket list we rented a cabin for two days at Velo de Novia. It was our understanding that the cabinets were newer this is why we picked his side. The cabin was absolutely clean nice with  A good bed, nice  hot water, and believe it or not Internet  Service , we stayed in cabin number for my has been and night he is 80 years old and I\'m 62 and we climbed the waterfall it was amazing there\'s a lot of places for us to sit down and take your time there\'s a snack bar on the way up and halfway up there\'s a very clean restroom with toilet paper soap and water and even a mirror.  They have this zip line where you could come down really quick . But we decided not to do that. It\'s an amazing view all the way up I hardly recommend it for anyone thinking about coming here. I took several pictures of all the signs and the trails,

543463890.author: a TripAdvisor user

543077111.reviewBody: Two hours drive from San Crist\u00f3bal there are amazing waterfalls to see. The road is difficult and slow but it worth it. You climb the mountain for an hour and there they are. Beautiful site.

540437378.name: You should spend the night here
540437378.author: a TripAdvisor user
540437378.reviewBody: We visited El Chiflon as part of a day tour (which was terrible), but the Chiflon site is definitely worth a visit.  Great surroundings, a nice walk up and a great waterfall.  We would have loved to have more time here.  Half a day would have been great, staying here for the night with a full moon - would have been fantastic.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

530750292.name: Spectacular waterfalls
530750292.author: a TripAdvisor user
530750292.reviewBody: I visited in Oct. during the rainy season so the falls were spectacular with the amount of water flowing. Many fotos show a calm river with turquoise colored water. You won\u2019t see that at this time of the year. What you will see are rushing falls & a river overflowing its banks. There are paths on both sides of the river with stairs when necessary to get the highest waterfall, El Chifl\u00f3n. The entire walk is about a km & you should have good shoes or sandals for the last part. I got so wet getting close to the falls that even the money in my wallet got wet and I was completely soaked. I hired a guide which isn\u2019t necessary but I felt he was worth the nominal cost.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

502181984.name: Most beautiful place with canope
502181984.author: a TripAdvisor user
502181984.reviewBody: It is a winderful place, natural wonder very well conserved. Amazing and a must do if you visit Chiapas! Clean and not expensive at all!\n2 canopes 400 and 600 meters long are fun.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

490834000.name: Great Falls / Beautiful River
490834000.author: a TripAdvisor user
490834000.reviewBody: This place is nice!  We camped in the parking lot and had the place to ourselves at night and in the morning.  There are also cabanas for rent.  The falls are spectacular and the river very pleasant.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

469493885.name: Amazing Falls!
469493885.author: a TripAdvisor user
469493885.reviewBody: The drive from San Cristobal is short but full of turns and speed bumps.  If going on a tour van you will probably need Dramamine.  Once there, you have a choice of going left or right...a word of caution: if you take the right side it\'s supposed to be even more spectacular, but you must be careful because there have been a few accidents on that side.  The reason is because during the rainy season, and because there is more shade on that side, the steps up are green and slippery.  We took the left side, witch has quite a few pools to swim in (note: they\'re freezing!) that are beautiful.  If you have back problems, heart problems, fear of heights, leg problems or are out of shape....forget it; this isn\'t for you.  If you can go up hundreds of steps (there are stops and clean/free bathrooms along the way) you won\'t regret it.  I\'m 47 and in pretty good shape.  It was tiring but not impossible.  And very much worth it!  You can go down in less steps + a very long zip line ($150 pesos).  Snacks and water can be purchased at the end.  Hope you are staying in Comitan because if you go back to San Cristobal it\'s just too long a trip.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

459821114.name: Very beautiful waterfall in southern Mexico
459821114.author: a TripAdvisor user
459821114.reviewBody: This waterfall attraction is very beautiful.  Lots of stairs moving up through a series of waterfalls is a bit strenuous but probably not for the younger set.  Plus! You can zip-line down!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

459639064.name: A great experience
459639064.author: a TripAdvisor user
459639064.reviewBody:
On a day long trip to the falls and Montebello lakes.
The falls are clean, spotless, seemingly endless. A great guide provided gratis.
We hiked to the top, incredible views and colors. A short chance to swim in chilly waters. 
An incredible outing!  But, not for physically unfit since it's a trek.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

447606619.name: Family visit
447606619.author: a TripAdvisor user
447606619.reviewBody: The place is just wonderful everything is nature. The place is very clean and the walking time all the way up is like a 45 minute walk and it is steep. No walk for people with disabilities, it is a shame. But the place is really nice\n

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

447040159.name: Beautiful & coooold
447040159.author: a TripAdvisor user
447040159.reviewBody:
We visited these waterfalls in December & the experience itself was amazing; the waterfalls & the places to swim are very worth it (or cost $30 MXN), but getting there was a nightmare because the highways we had to take (from San Cristobal de las Casas to Comitán & from Comitán to Tzinup or something like that) were both being repaired, so it took us like 3 extra hours to get there than what we planned.

Apart from that, we had a very nice time walking towards the waterfall "la Novia", swimming & on the zip line. 

Tip 1: zip line costs $150-$300 (MXN)

Tip 2: bring food & stuff to drink. It's very cozy & suitable for it. 

Tip 3: I would recommend you to try to go when there is not a lot of people (I would've seized it easy more, honestly)

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

440247234.name: Out for a zip
440247234.author: a TripAdvisor user
440247234.reviewBody: Likely the most picturesque waterfall in the world. Moderate hike in and then zip line out for like 9 USD. I can\'t believe this place isn\'t super crowded, it should be the top tourist destination in all of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

436247566.name: Beautiful !
436247566.author: a TripAdvisor user
436247566.reviewBody: Nice to see. We were late, but having time you can also jump for a swim in this stunning place. \n\nThere is also a dry cave with a river inside. For a bit extra. Of course. ;)

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

405428156.name: A few tips
405428156.author: a TripAdvisor user
405428156.reviewBody: Everyone says it\'s beautiful, and wow, yes.  Left side or right side? (When you arrive there are two entrances not 50 feet apart.  As you drive out from Tzomil, the first is the "right" and the second is "left.")  We took the left because we were very early (8:20 AM) and there was a guy waving a flag, so.  It was great, beautifully laid out, with two restaurants and other conveniences that do not (surprisingly) interfere with the abundant natural beauty.  The left has plenty of awesome overlooks, but the right seems to have the ultimate viewing spot for the last, largest waterfall --  right in the spray.  I bet you can\'t go wrong with either left or right.  The entrance fee is so low -- 30 pesos per person -- it is a real bargain.  We were glad to be there early, since on our way down, it was much more crowded than on the way up, when we were almost alone.  Guides are available and your tip is their pay (as far as I could figure).  We went without;  you can\'t get off the trail, it\'s totally obvious and marked.   Both sides have zip lines. (We decided against it -- we spend a lot of time in Mexico, and pretty much every day there is something that doesn\'t work right.  But most of them can\'t kill you ;-)

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

403359007.name: Best waterfalls
403359007.author: a TripAdvisor user
403359007.reviewBody: Great place to see nature. Loved it. 3 waterfalls, zipline and u can swim as well. Little off the beaten path but highly recommend it!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

393066456.name: Spectacular
393066456.author: a TripAdvisor user
393066456.reviewBody:
This is an amazing outing and well worth a visit. The waterfalls at each stage were beautiful with clear blue waters. The biggest one at the end was worth the sweaty hike, although it's not extremely difficult. It's a lovely natural site that only cost us $30 pesos each to get in. Things like this are usually really expensive so it's a treat to get in for so little. 

I wish we'd been more prepared because you can swim at the bottom in the cool waters which would have been more amazing after the ascent. They also have bbqs at the bottom so you could bring food and cook it there. I'd go back again in a heartbeat.

One word of warning if you're driving, the road out from Comitan is littered with big potholes, so drive carefully!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

387624100.name: A must go!
387624100.author: a TripAdvisor user
387624100.reviewBody: The cascada el chiflon or also known as Velo de Novia is a must see when visiting San Cristobal.  One the way up you\'ll encounter many different smaller waterfalls, and the last one absolutely amazing.  In our tour it included a tour guide, which was not really necessary although he was the nicest guy, and a great photographer.  \nIt\'s about an hour to go all the way up and its all stairs. I recommend to wear sneakers to be more comfortable.  \nOn the way down i did the zip line. Its 150 pesos and lasts about 1 minute. Its short but a cool experience.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

363427672.name: A great scenery of waterfalls
363427672.author: a TripAdvisor user
363427672.reviewBody: The drive from Comitan to the waterfalls is 45 minutes nice scenery driving trough villages. Arriving at the waterfalls park your car and have a great walk and see the waterfalls. The set up off the park is very nice. Easy walking tracks,the water is very clear and nice blue colours. There are food and drinks stalls also accommodations and campinggrounds. Take swimming gear with you for a nice swim.Take your time it is worth it.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

358337001.name: Amazing waterfall with added fun
358337001.author: a TripAdvisor user
358337001.reviewBody: It\'s a fantastic waterfall. We visited in March with a tour from San Cristobal de las Casas and there was lots of water. Climate was great. There is a 1 km walk up to the second (and main) waterfall and you can bath and enjoy a canopy ride more at for kids and adults. Must go if you are around. \n\nThere is this one thing. The two sides of the cascade are exploited by two separate businesses. We took the entrance on the left looking towards the waterfall and I believe the other one (on the right side) has slightly better views. Also the canopy on the right side one is close to the main waterfall although they told us it has a shorter flight (300m vs 450m)

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

358242893.name: Great scenic day out
358242893.author: a TripAdvisor user
358242893.reviewBody: Spectacular scenery, a chain of waterfalls along a river with nice swimming & picnic areas. Range of snack bars & shops.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

354101648.name: AMAZING!!!
354101648.author: a TripAdvisor user
354101648.reviewBody: Such a beautiful waterfall, trail to explore. There was food shacks, cabin accommodations, swimming in the river, etc. It may be a big trek to the top, but you can always zip line 3/4 of the way back down, and for only 250 pesos!!! We went on a cloudy day, was perfect!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

349994996.name: Gorgeous!
349994996.author: a TripAdvisor user
349994996.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful waterfalls I\'ve ever seen... It\'s so tall I had to shoot it as a panoramic to get the entire height of it in one picture. Real easy to get to by car and not too far of a drive from Tuxtla or San Cris. Plus it\'s a nice easy walk up to the bottom of the falls along the river.  Definitely recommend checking it out while in Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

346694156.name: Incredible spot in Chiapas
346694156.author: a TripAdvisor user
346694156.reviewBody: The Cascadas El Chiflon are simply amazing. Roads in Chiapas are not the best, so the trip from bigger cities such as Tuxtla or San Cristobal can be tiersome, but once you are there is completely worth it. The way up to the furthest waterfall is about 30-40 min, but there are several waterfalls that make the walk a nice one. There are two paths up, one will take you to the tallest zip line (there are two zip lines) and the other one takes you to the path for the "Corona" waterfall, the highest of all. Still both take you to the "Velo de Novia" waterfall wich is by far the most imprssive. Still, they told us there are very nice views from the "Corona" waterfall, but we didn\'t het there at the end. The restaurant has very good food and WiFi, which was a great thing since there was no 3G/4G connectiona and since we rented a carbwe needed Google Maps to tell us the way back. All in all, it was worth the trip to see such beautiful and impressive place.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

342213034.name: One of the most Beautiful places in Mexico
342213034.author: a TripAdvisor user
342213034.reviewBody: I am a frequent traveler, and I can honestly say this is one of the most beautiful places in the world. It is breathtaking, lovely and full of nature. The cascade is amazing!! January is a great month to visit because the color of the water is blue and sooo clear!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

336077945.name: Breathtaking place
336077945.author: a TripAdvisor user
336077945.reviewBody: This is one of the most amazing falls I ever seen.\nThe turquoise colour of the water is beautiful and you can even swim there. I recommend going during November-February so that you can appreciate the beautiful colour of the water.\nSome people say that getting to the last fall may be tiring but I don\'t think so, it is something you shouldn\'t miss if you visit Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

334693419.name: Great Place to go!
334693419.author: a TripAdvisor user
334693419.reviewBody: It is really awesome. There\'s a lot of stairs to walk and it\'s also very hot but worth everything.\n\nDefinitely a place worth going to.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

329416998.name: Lovely and savage
329416998.author: a TripAdvisor user
329416998.reviewBody: A nice long walk up to the waterfalls, get a coconut with gin on the way down. Try to catch a glimpse of the local iguanas, colorful!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

311557820.name: Great waterfall to admire!
311557820.author: a TripAdvisor user
311557820.reviewBody: Location is a little far away, and you need to walk trough a stairways to arrive there, but once you find it its just impressive. I would recommend visit the park on the left side (there are 2 different companies, one left and one right). The left one gives you much better view. To return, you can use the "tiroleza" and have a great experience

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

309796583.name: Excepcionally beautiful, enjoy your time there.
309796583.author: a TripAdvisor user
309796583.reviewBody: There are two entrances to see these beautiful waters.  We went in on the left side which has parking, restaurant, stores, bathrooms and excellent pathways up to the various waterfalls.  It cost 30 pesos per person.  We only made it up to Velo de Novia, there is more to climb for the travelers in good shape.  There is a zip line for 150 pesos from about half way down, but we didn\'t experience that. We loved our time there.  We came in on the road through Las Rosas and not Comitan because there was a road blockade between Tzimol and Comitan (unfortunately a common occurrence in Chiapas).  Be sure to visit this amazing area.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

298114843.name: Amazing waterfalls and beautiful nature!!
298114843.author: a TripAdvisor user
298114843.reviewBody:
This is one of my favourite national parks in Mexico! There is no words to describe how beautiful the waterfalls are and how colourful the water is. This is a Must Go place, you won't regret! Roads aren't bad at all if you come from Comitan, there is a few curves but nothing extreme. The waterfalls are worth your drive and time 100%. The water is crystal and there is so many spots where you can get amazing views and pics of the waterfalls, don't forget to bring your bathing suit and have an awesome swim in crystal waters. I went with my girlfriend but this place is for everyone. If you also like extreme adventures, you can't leave without zip lining from the very top of the waterfall (velo de novia) to the next waterfall (500m zip line). This is an amazing experience and you will get more awesome views from there.

Tip: make sure you bring running shoes because you will have to hike uphill like 4km to get to the top of the main waterfall 
Thumps up if you like my comment

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

291321363.name: A must see in Chiapas
291321363.author: a TripAdvisor user
291321363.reviewBody: This was one of our last stops while visiting friends in Comitan. Amusingly, a soap opera was filming scenes when we arrived! The hike was beautiful with numerous views and misty areas close to the falls. At the top there is a zip line, it looked great but we didn\'t stop to try. An incredible experience for any traveler and can be a relaxing cool hike or an adventure packed ride depending on what you\'re looking for.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

286735401.name: Unexpectedly stunning
286735401.author: a TripAdvisor user
286735401.reviewBody: We were on a tour (380 pesos for the entire day) from San Cristobal to the Montebello lakes and this was part of the tour. We hadn\'t heard of it before, which I think added to the experience. We were expecting a pretty waterfall, but nothing could prepare us for what we found at the end of the trail, absolutely beautiful!! Would 100% recommend.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

277527321.name: Stunning waterfalls and cascades
277527321.author: a TripAdvisor user
277527321.reviewBody: What a great ending to our Mexico journey. We really loved the place. The place is almost as beautiful as Plitvice Lakes National Park in Croatia, Europe. We could dip in the river to cool down and that was a great plus. We stayed two nights in the cabana (camping is also possible but then one is surrounded by people during the day). As the park closes by 17o\'clock it got much more peaceful and we almost had the entire place for us alone. If you are on the hunt for good photos/videos you might want to cross the river to get to see both sides. Apparently there are two different companies and there is no connecting bridge. Avoid weekends/holidays. There is a tiny shop and a restaurant (we had enough supplies bought in Comitan and did not need to do any shopping in the nearby village). The owners made a noticable effort to keep the place clean.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

277086660.name: Beautiful waterfalls
277086660.author: a TripAdvisor user
277086660.reviewBody: A series of many waterfalls that get gradually bigger until you reach the El Chiflon. The water is of beautiful green-blue color and the walkway even has places to pic-nic easily. A good place to stay for half of a day.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

271016566.name: Really cool cascadas
271016566.author: a TripAdvisor user
271016566.reviewBody: You can swim in the river after hiking to the different waterfalls. The water has a beautiful blue color and the temperature is really nice.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

268524757.name: Magnificent. Clean, natural, 100% recommended.
268524757.author: a TripAdvisor user
268524757.reviewBody: We drove from Comitan, Chiapas. It\'s around 45 minutes (because the roads are not so awsome) but it is totally worth it. Upon arrival you will be greated by one of the guides that work there. They are not paid by the owners, the offer their services and they have no fee, you can give them as much as you want. I didn\'t hire a guide because we were in romantic mode ;) The place is like this: there are two parkings, both with a lot of space. Then you enter the place and you find the restrooms (warning! the restrooms are only at the entrance) and then you continue up the path and find some small huts that sell food and drinks (all run by local people). There are two main paths that run along the river/waterfalls. I took the one on the left (as you go up). BOth sides run along it, but the left one goes the highest and the view from there is amazing. Nobody told us that, but we got lucky, so I share the info. If you have enought time, you could even do both. It\'s between 1 and 1.5 km up the hill. And it\'s HOT. So take your time going up (I saw the guides were pretty fast-paced btw) and enjoy nature. After all, is only 1km :) It has numerous spots to stop and take pictures! And it is simply awsome. The 17 co-owners (all from tzeltal and tzotzil comunities) have kept it very natural and they do keep it very clean. Entrance fee is $30 mexican pesos (around 2 euros) per person. The river is cristal clear and very cold, but after going up and down under the sun, you\'ll just want to get in there! You can camp there (we didn\'t know, but if you like camping, TOTALLY consider bringing your equipment) and there are facilities for grilling too! There\'s a small cafe with local food and a medium size restaurant.  \nTIPS: if you come with family, bring nice food for grilling :) And plan arriving early, because it\'s a place so peacefull that you\'ll want to spend more than a couple hours there! They open at 8am (as far as I know).\nThis is a natural place, so if you are the "theme park" type, it might not be the greatest place for you, but I can assure you\'ll like it anyways.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

267710309.name: Spectacular. Worth the drive from San Cristobal.
267710309.author: a TripAdvisor user
267710309.reviewBody: We came here on a day trip during August from San Cristobal. It was a long drive (3.5 hours) to get here but it was really worth it. The main 120 metre Velo di Nova Fall is a fantastic sight. We have also also been to Victoria Falls in Zambia/Zimbabwe and I would say that these falls (El Chiflon is 10 metres higher but of course nowhere near as wide) is as impressive. This is particularly because here you are standing at the bottom (so lots of spray), whereas at the Victoria Falls you see them at the top.\n\nThe hike up towards to falls from the car park (about 30 minutes or so) is not too strenuous. Come in sturdy shoes with good soles and you will be fine. The spray from the falls is incredible and we were glad that we had waterproofs. When we came back down we ate some mangos with lemon and salt - my daughter was not expecting salt - but they were delicious.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

266142844.name: Marvellous Waterfalls
266142844.author: a TripAdvisor user
266142844.reviewBody:
A series of waterfalls becoming more and more beautiful as you proceed along the route until you reach the climax - the unbelievable El Chiflon, falling from a height of more than 100 meters. A sight you wont forget.
The nature reserve very clean and well kept with hardly no vendors on the way. Swimming possible in stream (shallow). Fun omegas running over the stream the longest of them 450 meters long. 
Less than 40 minutes drive from Comitan with very reasonable access by car.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

265481863.name: The Best Waterfall
265481863.author: a TripAdvisor user
265481863.reviewBody: This was an awesome hike to reach, one of the best views of a nice waterfall. "El Velo De Novia", is a breathtaking view. Arrive on time to take advantage of the entire park. Such a relaxing view and highly recommend this amazing view! Take a good hiking shoes, sunblock,hat and water!! Don\'t forget your clothing to bathe in the beautiful river!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

263122469.name: Beautiful natural wonder
263122469.author: a TripAdvisor user
263122469.reviewBody:
This site is not to be missed if you are in the area.  Wear hiking shoes with good support and slip-proof soles - no heels, sandals or loafers, really.  
Our visit was in February and the day was pleasantly warm.  The drive from the north was lovely.  
The hike along the river here is a steady upslope - good cardio, and not for the mobility challenged.  That said, there are beautiful spots to rest and enjoy the view along the way up, and viewing platforms where you can take photos and dream about how you wish you were nowhere else :-)
This is a series of clear aquamarine pools and churning cascades that increase in drama and height as the slope increases until you are looking almost straight up into a magnificent waterfall.  
We took the 1500 meter zipline down to add further adventure to our day, and enjoyed a nice meal in the restaurant there. 
Bathrooms at the restaurant were very nice - bonus.  You could certainly bring a picnic and couldn't pick a better spot!
We were sweaty when we got to the top from exertion - may want to have a layer you can remove for comfort sake.
We didn't see any swimmers, but one in our party did jump in - just FYI.  
Highly recommend this site for the capable adventure seeker.
The Lakes of Montebello are a nice stop if you are southbound from this site.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

260973724.name: Need strong legs
260973724.author: a TripAdvisor user
260973724.reviewBody:
We were staying in San Cristobal de las casas and hired a guide and driver with the advice of our Hotel Guayaba inn.  It was a 3.5 hour drive thru many small pueblos in the Chiapis mountains.  I am pretty good at driving and finding places in Mexico, i doubt if I would have found this in the same day.
Put you hiking clothes on. There are many small falls and 3 big ones. Much can be seen even by a casual walker but to get to the "Novia" falls is quite a hike up hundreds of stairs.
The water has a pretty blue haze that must be a product of minerals in the limestone Rio
Vinciente.  You will see lots of water but I suggest you bring lots to drink.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

259502302.name: GO LIGHT ON THIS WALK!
259502302.author: a TripAdvisor user
259502302.reviewBody: This was an amazing place, unfortunately for us it was rain season, but aside from that its beautiful. The stairs going up to the cascade was slippery, but all worth it once we reached the very top. Defenitly recomend it for the family, but go during the dry season. The tour guides says its better and the water is clearer.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

258972535.name: Forget your Zumba class today!!!
258972535.author: a TripAdvisor user
258972535.reviewBody: A MUST!!! My best advise when you visit is TAKE YOUR TIME! There are many, many stairs but it\'s all on a gradual inclide (mostly ;) but just remember there are places to rest after you\'ve conquered each set of stairs. The view of the beautifully hued water is worth the trip. But once you reach the view point for the "Velo de Novia" (Bride\'s Vail) you will forget those darn stairs! There is another view point from the top of the Velo, but only my daring husband went. He was glad the rest of us didn\'t go because he said the path was rough, slippery with rock and very steep. But, I did see other people go up that path...

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

249034803.name: Hard climbing, gorgeous falls!
249034803.author: a TripAdvisor user
249034803.reviewBody: The park has more than 3 falls and to get each one track is required. All are beautiful and the color of the water in this region is a stunning turquoise. The last waterfall, Velo de Novia, is the most impressive, but the trail is pretty steep, all on stairs, but a tiring climb. Once there, there\'s no way to regret. The waterfall is huge and you can go to an observatory being right next to it!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

246334165.name: Lovrky
246334165.author: a TripAdvisor user
246334165.reviewBody:
It's totally worth the visit.
There are two entrances one public and the other private. On the private one very few people but once you get to the top there is nothing to drink. 
On the public one lots of people and something to drink at the top.
Beautiful view.
Take your swimming suit.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

240843543.name: No words can describe it!
240843543.author: a TripAdvisor user
240843543.reviewBody:
Every waterfall is different, I know. But this one is on league of it's own!!

There are two properties on either side or the river, I visited the one called "El Chiflon" ecopark; it turned out to be the better choice for me since it goes all the way into the waterfall and most of the cool pic's you see are taken there.

It's sort of a long curvy drive, but it's all so worth it! The park it self is so very clean and well organized and signaled, it has all the amenities at reasonable prices and staff are very hospitable.

Be prepared to walk up hill for some kilometers (and back again), unless you want to stay at lower waterfalls (about 4) . Some water shoes, instead of flip flops or tennis shoes, will work wonders since the steps to the main waterfall are really slippery and bring a change of clothes and a towel, 'cause you'll be soaked by the time you reach the last amazing terrace, also a waterproof camera will do the trick.

Avoid going right after it rains, the water will be murky and very strong currents can spoil your swim.

After you're done, eat at the main restaurant, the food is delicious, service is great and prices are so reasonable, then return to a great sleep (you'll be so tired and glad you went)!!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

240613042.name: Fantastic Park
240613042.author: a TripAdvisor user
240613042.reviewBody: We drove from Comitan to the Park.  It\'s an easy and safe drive and there\'s parking at the Cascadas.  Many, many steps to climb, but it seems each step brings another incredible view.  Took so many photos.  My friend took the zip line as he had never done this before.  He loved it.  Anyone in the Comitan area who doesn\'t visit is making a mistake---this is really a spectacular place that is inexpensive and nature at its best.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

233662596.name: Beautiful, friendly, safe, clean...Wonderful!
233662596.author: a TripAdvisor user
233662596.reviewBody: We took a bus out from Comitan so we had some extra walking (could have taken a Tuk-Tuk).  It was a great place to get immersed in nature yet they also had plenty of places you could get food and beverage.  We hiked to all three falls.  The last one is simply breathtaking.  We didn\'t take the zipline down but maybe next time!  We would definitely like to return and do some more hiking in this wonderland!

225987435.name: Nature at its best!

225887003.name: So much energy
225887003.author: a TripAdvisor user
225887003.reviewBody: One of my personal favourites!\nThere\'s nothing like the feeling of freedom standing under a waterfall as beautiful and powerful as this one! \nIf you are adventurous don\'t think twice and get into the depths of the cave, there\'s a surprise in there.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

222963913.name: WOW AMAZING BREATH TAKING
222963913.author: a TripAdvisor user
222963913.reviewBody:
went a few year back... but oh my that scenery is just incredible.... no words to explain you just have to have see for yourself

ok so getting there is easy... many tours will take you there... It really doesnt matter where in chiapas you are.... this waterfalls are well known... so just work out your schedule to arrive early and be there a good part of the day.... 

there is many activities you can do here... from swimming to just admiring the waterfalls.....
YOU MUST TAKE....
great walking shoes, really comfortable please... you will walk walk and walk and walk and guess what!! its all uphill so be prepared.... 
swimming gear specially if your taking little ones
and and extra sets of clothes because YOU WILL GET WET... 

ok so we arrived early, and we were just there to walk the trail up to the last possible point... its a long walk but it is well worth it... it had been raining the past few days... so we were on our own... they told us to be extremely careful the dirt was loose and the waterfalls were extremely full and did not recommend us to walk up BUT HEY WE WERE THERE ALREADY..  there is a few waterfalls before arriving the the tallest one called "velo de novia"  well you can imagine the walk with all the loose ground because of the water but it was fun!!! 

at last we arrived to the highest point... there is a chance to do zip lining but the waterfall was so pack with water that the amount of water dispersed around it was really heavy... as if it was pouring a storm so the zip line was closed... 

anyways it was an awesome experience and will go again. by the time we got back people were arriving some were in the river enjoying their day.. others were in the restaurant which smelled great... did not try it..... some were going in to the cabins they have there... all in all, a very excellent place... 

NO CONS: from my visit I have nothing to complain..... everything was great the place does the job by itself its natural beauty, its amazing, its just great.... its great to appreciate creation and its beauty...

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

221237110.name: Breath taking  waterfalls
221237110.author: a TripAdvisor user
221237110.reviewBody: If you are near comitan or San Cristobal de Las Casas , you must go to El chiflon as they are one of the many natural wonders of Chiapas. It takes a while to get there from Comitan but the trip is worth it. Accessible by public transport also.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

216643162.name: If you visit Montebello, plan to visit El Chifl\u00f3n and Tenam Puente.
216643162.author: a TripAdvisor user
216643162.reviewBody: If you are exploring Chiapas wonderful sites and have an extra day to relax and enjoy a beautiful waterfall do not miss this place, specially if you are planning the magnificent Montebello lakes.\nBesides, you can visit Tenam Puente , a very interesting archeological that few visitors know. \nAlthough there are not many things to do in Comitan, perhaps is a good idea to spend a night in this city and take this town as a base to relax and a place to find average restaurants in the main plaza.  Do not forget to carry a swimsuit,towel and enough sunblock. I recommend to rent a car but remember to rent an automatic one because Chiapas roads are really full of "deadcops".

212421788.name: Great day trip
212421788.author: a TripAdvisor user
212421788.reviewBody:
I took the day trip to Cascada El Chiflon ,  when  arrive you should go upstairs (half hour)
and you can see this huge waterfall.
The trip also includes a visit at Lagos de Montebello after waterfall.
Really recommended !!!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

208796965.name: Take your swim suit
208796965.author: a TripAdvisor user
208796965.reviewBody: This is a great day trip from Comitan.  We were on our way to Lagos de Montebello when we backtracked a bit to see the falls. This worked out great because in the end we enjoyed El Chiflon better than Los Lagos. The community who owns the river front has it well organized and maintained. You walk up the river pass ever larger falls until you get to the most powerful. There is a great little perch safely sitting on an outcropping right before the falls. There you can stand directly in front of the great mass of falling of water and contemplate the marvel of nature while getting showered with spray and water vapor blown by gusts and followed by rainbows. \nDont forget your swim suit. There are a few designated swimming areas with changing rooms. Swim in one on the way up and another on the way down. The water has a mineral that glazes over the rocks and creates different hues of blue. We enjoyed plastering ourselves with the very fine mud we found on river bottom which was very soothing for the pores. We had fun with our wild tribal look. We sighted several blue Morpho butterflies as well as found trees with ripe chico zapotes.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

204312124.name: Beautifull
204312124.author: a TripAdvisor user
204312124.reviewBody: Waterfalls are the best, not a lot of people and you can swim if you want, stay hole day if you can, bring your own water and sandwiches

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

200639069.name: Great day trip
200639069.author: a TripAdvisor user
200639069.reviewBody: Had a great half day, its unmissable. Wear good walking shoes and take swimming gear. The park is very well organised, with an information desk and a few shops and foodplaces. Its not spoiled with loads of souvenier shops like aqua azual. You can take a picnic and/or use the bbqs. We travelled by combis from Comitan which pass by the ADO bus station, on the same side to go to chiflon, however they may be full there as they depart a few blocks before the station, you may need to ask. There are cabanas for overnight stays see www.chiflon.com.MX.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

198984774.name: Stunning.  Simply stunning!
198984774.author: a TripAdvisor user
198984774.reviewBody:
Admission is $30 pesos per person. The park opens at 9 am daily. We arrived around 10 am.

Bring hat, sun block, bathing suit and snacks.  Make sure you wear walking/hiking shoes because there are 5+  Waterfalls to view. The last three are high up the top of hundreds of steep stairs.

If you are up for a challenge, make sure you go to the top (30-40 minute hike on paved stairs). The view is incredible.

After the hike we spent time cooling off and playing in the River. The water was refreshing.  I recommend bringing water shoes for this because the rocks can hurt your feet.

My 9 year old and I went down the 'tirolesa' (zip line). Cost was $250 pesos per person. It was exciting and well worth the cost.  No one there accepts credit card so make sure you bring pesos. 

You can bring your own food and  drinks and eat at the covered tables by the River or buy food there from the vendors.  I was told there is a restaurant on site but never went to check it out.

From Downtown Comitan it took us 50 minutes by car.  It is about 2.5 hours from Tuxtla Gutierrez. 

This place is amazing.  I highly recommend you go.  You won't regret it.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

198455579.name: Very beautiful place
198455579.author: a TripAdvisor user
198455579.reviewBody: It\'s a long trip, about 3 hours from San Cristobal to El Chilf\u00f3n. I took this tour along with a visit to the Lagunas de Montebello. At El Chifl\u00f3n, the waterfall is impressive, the sound is so beautiful that you will forget everything. I recommend bringing sunscreen, some water to drink but especially be eager to walk because the tour guides will tell you that there are 800 steps to go. I recommend going early to visit:  El Chifl\u00f3n and the Lagunas de Montebello before 16:00 h. to admire the different shades of the water of the lakes.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

191903373.name: Spectacular
191903373.author: a TripAdvisor user
191903373.reviewBody:
A real hidden gem a bit off the "Gringo trail".  Not by much but I guess enough that most will miss this "top ten" waterfalls. (world travelers, and we have seen alot of them) Simply spectacular setting with a monster waterflow.  Wonderfully constructed pathway along the river leading to the falls.  Truly another delight of Mother nature enhanced by man's infrastructure, which isn't always the case.
How to get there:
From San Cristobal plan 3 hours just to get there. Take a collectiva 1.5 hr to Comitan (55 MX). The OCC bus leaves to late in the day to make it a comfortable day trip. The best is to relocate to Comitan, if possible.  Once in Comitan, cross the main street to get a collectiva that goes towards the falls NOT to the small village of Tzimol (25MX, 1 hr).  The falls are 10-20 km PAST Tzimol.  At the entrance get a tuk-tuk (5-10MX) for a short ride to the complex at the start of the pathway.  There is a 30MX park entrance fee. It's a 1200 m lovely path with many steps to get to the top fall but there are smaller falls along the way. There are lovely rooms at the complex, inside the park.  (400-700MX).
If we had been on the road too long and wanted to hang somewhere for a bit, this would have been the place to do it.  
This is a DON'T MISS site!

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

190941215.name: wonderfull place to visit, nature and its explendor
190941215.author: a TripAdvisor user
190941215.reviewBody: To get there takes a  little bit of time and patience however it is absolutely worthy.  You must make time to reach the top, I was unable to do it because I went with a tour,  all tours give you little time, and i took the TIROLESA.  I enjoy it very much. It is clean, with services and nature is incredible. must go with enough time to take pictures, go to the top, relax, eat something and then leave the place full of it .

184209725.name: Breath-taking
184209725.author: a TripAdvisor user
184209725.reviewBody: This is impressive waterfall. We took a tour from San Cristobal de las Casas. Therefore did not have enough time to climb all the way up. Its an exhausting trip but worth it. Amazing nature. Simply breath-taking experience. Before you enter the path, you buy water and make sure you wear good shoes. There is a rope across the canyon. Definitely do the rope. Adrenaline full.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco

181629999.name: Unbelievable
181629999.author: a TripAdvisor user
181629999.reviewBody:
We were there last week and this is the most amazing sight. The trail to the waterfall is extremely well cared for and we enjoyed our hike up. 

To get there from Comitan city center you would need to get a bus from the main street. It cost like 25 pesos, tell them you want to go to Chiflon. The collectivo kind of a bus will drop you off at a crossroad. There are 3 wheelers there and you will be approached by one of the drivers who will then charge you around 15 pesos to the waterfall/park. There is also an entrance fee. From the gates of the park you have a very nice trail leading up to the Falls with breaks in between that let you walk right to the water itself. The rail is populated by butterflies, beautiful ones. We went right up to the Falls and it is a spectacular sight! Highly recommended
Bonus is when you come back from the trail. Right where the shops are you will see a sign that says Iguanas. Walk up to the guard/information booth and ask to see the Iguanas. They will point them out to you as to the untrained eyes it is difficult to spot them. These guys are green or red and HUGE. We are talking at least 2 feet with long gorgeous tails. 
To get back you can take a 3 wheeler to the main road (this is something that will be available right at the entrance of the park, if you do not see one, just ask the information booth guard, he will call one in for you) The 3 wheeler will drop you off at the same cross roads and there you can flag down a collectivo bus back to Comitan.

This was a great experience for us and we enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: A 20 km de Comitan Ejido San Cristobalito Municipio De Tzimol Chiapas, Mexivco
